Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and we are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.


More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to make sure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues, as well as the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!


Data Analyst

What you’ll have to do:


  • Drive the conception, implementation, and development of the BI reporting landscape. This includes understanding stakeholder business needs, drafting specifications and monitoring/reviewing implementation with the BI team;
  • Act as a business partner and advisor for the commercial and financial department. Some recurrent needs can be solved with the help of the BI team, while other custom solutions should be provided by us. This means accessing and processing the data in a way that answers those needs;
  • Present results in a well-structured, efficient, and clear manner;
  • Derivate strategic recommendations based on comprehensive data analysis;
  • Standardize processes and reporting for enhanced efficiency;
  • Prepare ad-hoc reports and draw conclusions related to profitability, deliveries, product availability, active promotions, inventory levels, etc. based on stakeholder requests;
  • Offer support on data gathering, consolidation and verifications within the finance team.


How we’d like you to be:

  • 1-4 years of professional experience in data analysis;
  • Extensive knowledge of Excel and writing SQL queries;
  • Basic to intermediate knowledge of Pandas (Python) is an advantage;
  • Intermediate knowledge of BI tools (Tableau) is an advantage;
  • Strong organizational skills, ability to work independently, with a focus on quality, detail, and accuracy;
  • Quick comprehension and ability to grasp new topics in detail;
  • Enthusiasm for developing, organizing, and analyzing large datasets;
  • Ability to describe complicated issues concisely and understandably;
  • High-quality standards for your own work;
  • Excellent spoken and written English skills.

What we’ve prepared for you:


  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Tazz, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Atlas psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Data Analyst
Company: Trilogy International, A Korn Ferry Company
Description:
Location: Fully Remote (Client based in Dublin)

Contract Type: 6-Month Contract

Industry: Financial Services




About the Role:

We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst with expertise in the financial services sector to join our client's team. This role involves analysing and interpreting data to provide actionable insights that drive decision-making. The successful candidate will bring experience with Python, Power BI, and familiarity with Central Bank of Ireland (CBI) requirements, enabling them to support regulatory and business-critical projects.




Key Responsibilities:

Collect, clean, and analyse data to provide insights that support strategic objectives.
Design and develop dashboards and reports using Power BI to present complex data in a clear and accessible format.
Implement data models and pipelines in Python to support analytics and reporting needs.
Ensure compliance with Central Bank of Ireland (CBI) regulatory requirements in data processing and reporting.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data needs and deliver solutions that address business challenges.
Maintain data integrity and accuracy through rigorous quality checks and validation processes.




Key Requirements:

Proven experience in a Data Analyst role within the financial services industry.
Proficiency in Python for data analysis and pipeline development.
Strong skills in Power BI, including creating interactive dashboards and visualisations.
Familiarity with CBI regulations and experience in delivering compliant data solutions.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen eye for detail.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information to non-technical stakeholders.




Preferred Skills:

Experience with SQL for querying and managing data.
Knowledge of data governance and security best practices.
Familiarity with other data visualisation tools or programming languages is an advantage.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Would you like to join the European Energetic Transition?

FAAM is building a Gigafactory in Teverola for the production of cells, modules, and battery packs for Electric Vehicle, Energy Storage, Industrial, and Special applications.

In joining us you will take part in a very strategic project for the European lithium battery value chain.

We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst with a strong attitude to change management, who want to work with us in Teverola, Caserta, Italy.

We are looking for a dynamic, passionate, purpose-drive professional who wants to help us in the deployment of one of the most important projects in Europe.

Key Responsibilities Include But Are Not Limited To


Data analysis of Li-ion battery manufacture’s KPIs in the different processes
Develop data analysis standards and tools for automated analysis
Create reports, data dashboards, graphs and visualizations related to Li-on cell and battery products
Identify areas to increase efficiency, cost saving and process improvements
set up and maintain automated data processes
monitor and audit data quality
Developing and maintaining databases, and data systems – reorganizing data in a readable format
Performing analysis to assess the quality and meaning of data
design and carry out surveys and analyse survey data
mine and analyse large datasets, draw valid inferences and present them successfully to management using a reporting tool.
Preparing reports for the management stating trends, patterns, and predictions using relevant data
Working with the engineers and production to check the data


Requirements


Bachelor’s degree in computer science, economics, mathematics, statistics.
Work experience as a data analyst or in a related field.
Experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.
Understanding of addressing and metadata standards.
Experience with SQL
Knowledge of any programming language like Python, R
Power BI or other dashboarding software
Open approach reag
To collaborate directly with external consultants.
To be a team player willing to share knowledge and ideas.
Fluency in English (oral and written) is a MUST.
Fluency in Italian (oral and written) is a PLUS.
Ability to work under pressure, with flexibility and to manage tight deadlines.
Good pitch presentation ability is a PLUS.


Work conditions


Location in Teverola, Caserta, Southern Italy
Live and work close to Naples, Costiera Amalfitana, Capri, and Rome
Stimulating work environment
Full-time job
Salary to be defined with Management (negotiable)
Competitive conditions with good insurance and pension schemes
Start date: ASAP, on-site


Useful Links

FAAM Website

FAAM CAREER FAQs and careers section

Title: JUNIOR DATA ANALYST
Description:
Adecco Italia S.p.A., per multinazionale cliente operante nel settore della mobilità, ricerca:




JUNIOR DATA ANALYST




La risorsa sarà inserita all’interno della divisione Marketing e Business Development in un contesto fortemente dinamico ed orientato all’analisi dei dati.




Principali attività




Creazione e gestione di report per le diverse direzioni aziendali
Monitoraggio dei KPI aziendali
Supporto per elaborazione di bdgt e forecast
Analisi dati per fini analitici, predittivi e strategici
Gestione di comitati interni
Elaborazione di presentazioni strategiche




Requisiti




Laurea in Matematica/Statistica, discipline economiche
Gradita esperienza pregressa in contesti aziendali automotive, su progetti di Datawarehouse e di Business Intelligence con avanzato uso di strumenti di analisi dati e reporting
Gradita esperienza nella realizzazione di soluzioni di Business Intelligence e Analytics (Report, Dashboard, Data Modeling)
Conoscenza di DB relazionali con utilizzo di join complesse tra tabelle, costruzioni di query attraverso l’utilizzo del linguaggio SQL
Attività di analisi con applicativi quali SAS (es guide o SAS Base)
Gradita conoscenza di QLIKsense come strumento di reporting
Ottima conoscenza di Excel e del pacchetto Office (Power point, Access, Word)
Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia scritta che parlata
Buone capacità relazionali e comunicative con una spiccata capacità di lavorare in team




Sede: Roma.

Contratto: iniziale contratto di somministrazione a tempo determinato semestrale. Ral 32K. Buoni pasto.







I candidati ambosessi (L.903/77) sono invitati a leggere l’informativa sulla privacy.

Facsimile di domanda disponibile al seguente link Facsimile domanda candidatura.

ATTENZIONE: Abbiamo rilevato la presenza in rete di molti annunci falsi; prendi visione dei nostri consigli per riconoscere i tentativi di truffa al seguente link.

Adecco Italia S.p.A. (Aut. Min. Prot. N.1100-SG del 26.11.2004).

  • Attività di analisi con applicativi quali SAS (es guide o SAS Base)
  • Gradita conoscenza di QLIKsense come strumento di reporting
  • Ottima conoscenza di Excel e del pacchetto Office (Power point, Access, Word)
  • Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese, sia scritta che parlata
  • Buone capacità relazionali e comunicative con una spiccata capacità di lavorare in team


Sede: Roma.

Contratto: iniziale contratto di somministrazione a tempo determinato semestrale. Ral 32K. Buoni pasto.



I candidati ambosessi (L.903/77) sono invitati a leggere l’informativa sulla privacy.

Facsimile di domanda disponibile al seguente link Facsimile domanda candidatura.

ATTENZIONE: Abbiamo rilevato la presenza in rete di molti annunci falsi; prendi visione dei nostri consigli per riconoscere i tentativi di truffa al seguente link.

Adecco Italia S.p.A. (Aut. Min. Prot. N.1100-SG del 26.11.2004).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – AI/LLM (Entry-Mid Level)

Location: Munich, Germany | Salary: €50,000 – €65,000 per year + Benefits




Our client, an innovative leader in sustainable agriculture and food technology, is looking for a talented Data Analyst to join their Munich-based team. This is an exceptional opportunity to work on an AI-powered platform revolutionizing how food production and supply chains operate globally, driving efficiency, sustainability, and innovation in one of the world's most vital industries.




About the Role

You’ll be at the forefront of analyzing and optimizing data streams for a cutting-edge LLM-enabled software solution that supports farmers, agricultural businesses, and food manufacturers. By harnessing the power of AI, this platform provides actionable insights into crop management, supply chain optimization, and sustainability metrics, helping create a greener future for the food industry.




Responsibilities

Analyze agricultural and supply chain datasets to enhance AI/LLM performance and uncover key trends.
Support the development of predictive models that improve crop yield, resource allocation, and logistical efficiency.
Conduct experiments and validate data insights to refine AI-driven recommendations for farmers and producers.
Create dashboards and data visualizations tailored to stakeholders in agriculture and food technology.
Collaborate with product teams to address industry-specific challenges, from reducing food waste to optimizing sustainability practices.




What You’ll Need

Educational Background: A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Agricultural Engineering, or a related field.
Technical Expertise: Proficiency in Python, SQL, or R; familiarity with AI/ML frameworks and LLMs is a strong advantage.
Industry Knowledge: Interest or experience in agriculture, food technology, or sustainability-focused industries.
Analytical Skills: A demonstrated ability to translate complex datasets into actionable insights relevant to the agriculture sector.
Experience Level: 1–3 years in data analysis or a related role, preferably with exposure to AI technologies.
Language Skills: Fluency in English is essential; German proficiency is a plus.




Salary & Benefits

Competitive salary: €50,000 – €65,000 per year, depending on experience.
Benefits include health insurance, professional development opportunities, and team-building initiatives.
A flexible hybrid work model, based in Munich with remote working options.
The opportunity to work on cutting-edge AI solutions that have a tangible impact on sustainability and global food systems.




Why Join?

This is a chance to combine your analytical skills with a passion for sustainability and innovation. By joining this dynamic team, you’ll contribute to the future of AI in sustainable agriculture, helping to address some of the biggest challenges in food production and environmental stewardship.




How to Apply

If this sounds like your next challenge, we’d love to hear from you! Send your CV to dan.wotherspoon@intellectgroup.com or get in touch for more details.




Be part of shaping the future of sustainable food production through the power of AI!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - 6 Month Contract - Dublin ( Has potential movement to perm after)

(Stamp 4/ Eu citizen/ UK citizen/ Stamp 1g spouse visa)

3 days onsite 2 days work from home







Your new company




This company is a reputable high profile third level institution within the public sector based in Dublin.




Your new role




Plan, schedule and conduct a review of the end-user population of the Finance Systems
Develop and maintain supporting process documentation
Capture, analyse and document user access, authorities, and permissions within the Finance Systems
Develop relationships with key stakeholders to assess and establish business requirements for all users within their areas of responsibility
Provide on-going guidance & feedback to key stakeholders
Manage stakeholders’ issues, interactions, and expectations
Generate detailed reports and dashboards to provide insights and support decision-making processes
Work with personnel within the Finance Office to implement new role structures
Identify opportunities to streamline data management processes and contribute to efficiency improvements.










What you'll need to succeed




Need immediate joiner
5+ years experience as a Data Analyst
Strong PowerQuery experience and Excel .
Experience with accountancy software.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to convey messages in a clear and concise manner.
Strong Computer skills with a proficient working knowledge of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.
Relevant experience in data management & validation.
Microsoft Excel and Power Query Proficiency: Utilize advanced Excel functions/Power query features to analyse, manipulate, and present data effectively.
Proficiency in Tableau







What you'll get in return




Pay rate between €56K- 65K per annum - pro rata (Dependent on experience).
Opportunity to work with a reputable organization within the public sector
Hybrid work model. ( 3 days onsite, 2 days from home)
Work 35 hours per week
20 days holidays per annum - Pro rata basis




Eligibility




Currently living in Ireland.
Irish experience is a must
Flexible to work in a hybrid setting in Dublin.
Currently holding an EEA passport or valid Stamp 4 visa. (Visa must be for duration of contract).
Immediate starter (if possible).




If you find the role is relevant to your current skills, please feel free to apply or reach out !!!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What To Expect
Tesla is looking to hire an enthusiastic and experienced Analyst to support our business in EMEA. Business Analytics team is focused on building the reporting necessary to measure key performance indicators for Tesla’s sales, delivery and service teams, and increasing efficiency through data and analytics.

You will be tasked to provide proactive analyses helping to drive business programs and informed decisions. The Data Analyst should act as an advisor, ultimately helping leadership to identify and overcome challenges thereby helping to enhance the productivity of Tesla’s sales, delivery and service organization. The Analyst must be able to clearly communicate insights to the management teams. You will have the opportunity to develop and continuously improve the way we make decision based on data.

What You'll Do


Develop and implement detailed and accurate reports for the management team, providing visibility into performance against key business objective
Manipulate and interpret large datasets to deliver actionable insights to the management
Design intuitive and elegant visualizations to communicate key insights that drive business decisions
Improve the sales, delivery and service organization’s access to data via improved data generation and processing by partnering with our system analysts teams
Develop new tools to promote productivity and efficiency utilizing Tableau, SQL, Python and Tesla in-house reporting tools
Communicate effectively with the regional managers to identify and address areas for improvement
Build and maintain advanced models to measure, analyze, and forecast key metrics for our business in EMEA



What You'll Bring


Highly collaborative and team-oriented, while also able to work independently
Ability to deliver under tight deadlines and work on multiple tasks and projects at once
Experience with Tableau (or similar tooling like MS PowerBI, Qlik), SQL, and Microsoft Excel. Experience with Python and/or R is a plus
Excellent quantitative skills and a deep understanding of statistical methods with an ability to inspire confidence in data-driven decision making
Strong written and verbal communication skills



, Tesla

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Project Title: Data Analyst - Freelance




Project Overview: Our client is seeking skilled Data Analysts to join their team on a freelance basis. Currently, they are utilizing a central platform, but they are planning to migrate data to a dedicated platform for a specific domain. This project involves significant data migration tasks and requires expertise in SQL, Databricks, and Python.




Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with project managers and data engineers to ensure smooth data migration.
Analyze and interpret complex data sets to provide actionable insights.
Develop and maintain data pipelines using SQL, Databricks, and Python.
Work closely with the marketing team to support data-driven decision-making.
Ensure data quality and integrity throughout the migration process.




Team Structure:

Data Analysts (starting in January), with some focusing on the marketing domain.
Data Engineers to support the technical aspects of the migration.




Requirements:

Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in data migration projects.
Proficiency in SQL, Databricks, and Python.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.
Ability to work independently and manage time effectively.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
✨¿Quieres ser protagonista de soluciones que impacten a nivel global? ¡Forma parte del cambio!




💚 Somos Softtek, un grupo tecnológico global que integra una cultura única, beneficios y un gran desarrollo, tanto profesional como humano, con presencia en más de 20 países y 14 sedes en España. Generamos valor a través de la tecnología y nuestro objetivo es dejar huella y trascender en el ámbito de la transformación digital. Ya sumamos más 16.000 softtekians alrededor del mundo y seguimos creciendo.




En 2023 hemos sido reconocidos por la Lista Forbes como una de las 100 mejores empresas para trabajar en España, destacando por la flexibilidad y la personalización de la experiencia del empleado. Creemos que las personas con talento y autodeterminación son capaces de crear cosas asombrosas. ¿Nos acompañas en esta aventura? #FutureTogether




🔎¿Qué buscamos?

Un/a Data Analyst con al menos 4 años de experiencia. El objetivo principal es realizar análisis de causa raíz mediante datos, apoyando la validación y mejora de dispositivos HW.

Los requisitos más valorables son:

- Experiencia con SQL y conocimientos básicos de Python para extracción y análisis de datos.

- Conocimientos de flujos de proyectos, procesos de calidad y validación de dispositivos HW.

- Experiencia trabajando con grandes conjuntos de datos a través de herramientas de visualización y datos (Python, PBI)

- Nivel de inglés alto.

- Presencialidad inicial 3 días en las oficinas de Pozuelo (Madrid)

Los requisitos más deseables son:

- Storytelling: Capacidad para presentar datos de manera clara y comprensible.

- Orientación a la resolución de problemas y trabajo en equipo.

- Experiencia previa en QA, validación de dispositivos HW o roles similares.




💻 ¿Cómo será tu día a día?

Tendrás la oportunidad de asumir interesantes desafíos y trabajar con clientes internacionales de gran repercusión, utilizando tecnologías punteras y colaborando en equipos multidisciplinares en los que podrás aprender y aportar todo tu potencial, además podrás:




Analizar datos para identificar y resolver problemas en la fase beta de los proyectos.
Realizar análisis de causa raíz mediante herramientas analíticas.
Apoyar los flujos de proyectos, procesos de calidad y validación de dispositivos HW.
Extraer datos de bases de datos (SQL, Python) y realizar análisis detallados.




✅¿Qué ofrecemos?

Contrato indefinido.

👪 Posibilidad de teletrabajo, horario flexible y mejoras para favorecer la conciliación a través de nuestro programa BetterWork.

✈️24 días de vacaciones

🩺 Seguro médico

Retribución flexible: tarjeta transporte, tarjeta restaurante, cheque guardería o seguro médico familiares.

🎂 Tarde de cumpleaños libre (también por el cumple de tus hijos).

Club del empleado: ofertas y promociones exclusivas por ser Softtekian.

🎓 Planes de formación: idiomas, tecnologías y soft skills.

🌍 Oportunidad de movilidad interna: contamos con presencia internacional y diversas sedes en España.




Valoraremos especialmente la candidatura de personas que posean habilidades y capacidades únicas y diversas, reconociendo la importancia de facilitar su integración plena en el mercado laboral. Cada individuo, con sus capacidades singulares, aporta una riqueza invaluable a nuestra comunidad, y nuestro compromiso es asegurar que todos tengan la oportunidad de demostrar su valía y contribuir al crecimiento y la diversidad de nuestro equipo.




👀 ¿Todavía sigues aquí?

¡Tu incorporación es nuestra prioridad! No dudes en apuntarte, estamos deseando conocerte.

Title: Marketing Analyst (Data Analytics and BI)
Description:
Marketing Analyst (Data Analytics and BI)

At Samsung we approach everything we do with the spirit of a ‘joyful pioneer’- daring to defy barriers and striving to excel limits. At the heart of our DNA is the pursuit of excellence and bringing innovation to everyone, faster than anyone. We realize it’s our people who really make this possible and we are continuously looking for dynamic people to join us and share our vision. With our endless ability to predict the next big wave (and create a few of our own), joining Samsung Electronics will put you in touch with the future and keep your career at the cutting edge of tomorrow’s technology.




Samsung Electronics Romania is looking for a Marketing Analyst for the Digital, Strategy & Planning team.




The Marketing Analyst will be supporting the enhancement of the data collection, tracking and analytics capabilities of the Samsung marketing. The Marketing Analyst will be responsible for developing and implementing tracking and analytics plans, supporting with dashboards, reports and insights. Main internal stakeholders: wider marketing team (Category & Campaign, Digital, PR & Communication) and divisions. Markets to be covered: Romania and Bulgaria.

You will explore data to find trends and identify new opportunities for the organization. Also, you will help improve and automate current reporting activities.




Key Responsibilities

• You are organized, detailed oriented, flexible and possess ability to establish priorities with minimal guidance in a fast paced environment – be proactive, analytical problem solver and strategist, who is able to draw conclusions- not just report the data.

• Translate business requirements into meaningful set of reports, ad hoc analysis and new reporting solutions, and particularly related to marketing and sales activities

• Explore data to identify trends and anomalies, develop new analytical capabilities/solutions

• Transform and cleanse outputs from data warehouse into relevant analysis for business/sales teams

• Summaries analyses into PowerPoint presentations or formatted Excel reports

• Help explain analysis results to business team

• Automate and optimize current reports, will be owner for some specific audience dashboards to support the management.

• Collaborate to refine methodology and calculations




Skills and Qualifications




To be successful, you will possess the following skills and attributes:

• Proven experience using excel full time

• Extensive experience working in an agency or company leading media analytics

• Exposure to automation

• Experience working with large relational databases

• Demonstrated expertise in connecting various sources of data (across digital media channels or platforms) to create a holistic view of data

• Experience with statistical analysis/tools

• Familiarity with media, Digital / Mobile /TV KPI

• Strong written and verbal communication skills

• Experience with ad tech and digital media ops

• A high degree of analytical expertise is crucial, along with the ability to communicate test results in basic terms for consumption of non-technical colleagues.

• Willing to work closely with non-technical teams and learn new concepts

• Degree in computer science/engineering or quantitative discipline (Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics). Masters Preferred.

• Familiarity with Digital Marketing

• Proficient with Google Analytics

• Working knowledge of automation and CRM platforms

• Experience working with Domo, Tableau, and PowerBI

• Experience with AWS tools such as EC2 and S3.

• Jira, Confluence, GitHub and other agile development tool experience.

• Experience working with a DMP

• Experience with data visualization




What does success look like?




• A love for data and statistics, for example exploring data for fun, find patterns, create norms for marketing insights report results. You are curious and take initiatives on finding new insights, new angles are looking at the data and deep dive into the meanings of campaign insights results. Support the development of reporting capacities for all types of marketing activities.

• You have a passion to test and learn in a fast paced environment, your curiosity is outstanding.

• Help build a data-informed culture – provide decisions makers with the information they need when they need it and in a way they can trust and act on.

• Experience to develop strategic relationships with all areas of the business (sales, marketing, finance, business intelligence etc). You can root cause issues quickly and uncover core issues, then assist, collaborate with, and teach the teams how decisions affect efficiency, scalability, new mechanisms as they are needed.




Do you believe you have what it takes to become our new Marketing Analyst ? If so, we offer you a very stimulating job in an international and expansive company where your skills, ambitions and determination will decide your future. You will have the opportunity to work in an organization where the time from an idea to action is short.

Show more

• Summaries analyses into PowerPoint presentations or formatted Excel reports

• Help explain analysis results to business team

• Automate and optimize current reports, will be owner for some specific audience dashboards to support the management.

• Collaborate to refine methodology and calculations


Skills and Qualifications


To be successful, you will possess the following skills and attributes:

• Proven experience using excel full time

• Extensive experience working in an agency or company leading media analytics

• Exposure to automation

• Experience working with large relational databases

• Demonstrated expertise in connecting various sources of data (across digital media channels or platforms) to create a holistic view of data

• Experience with statistical analysis/tools

• Familiarity with media, Digital / Mobile /TV KPI

• Strong written and verbal communication skills

• Experience with ad tech and digital media ops

• A high degree of analytical expertise is crucial, along with the ability to communicate test results in basic terms for consumption of non-technical colleagues.

• Willing to work closely with non-technical teams and learn new concepts

• Degree in computer science/engineering or quantitative discipline (Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Physics, Mathematics). Masters Preferred.

• Familiarity with Digital Marketing

• Proficient with Google Analytics

• Working knowledge of automation and CRM platforms

• Experience working with Domo, Tableau, and PowerBI

• Experience with AWS tools such as EC2 and S3.

• Jira, Confluence, GitHub and other agile development tool experience.

• Experience working with a DMP

• Experience with data visualization


What does success look like?


• A love for data and statistics, for example exploring data for fun, find patterns, create norms for marketing insights report results. You are curious and take initiatives on finding new insights, new angles are looking at the data and deep dive into the meanings of campaign insights results. Support the development of reporting capacities for all types of marketing activities.

• You have a passion to test and learn in a fast paced environment, your curiosity is outstanding.

• Help build a data-informed culture – provide decisions makers with the information they need when they need it and in a way they can trust and act on.

• Experience to develop strategic relationships with all areas of the business (sales, marketing, finance, business intelligence etc). You can root cause issues quickly and uncover core issues, then assist, collaborate with, and teach the teams how decisions affect efficiency, scalability, new mechanisms as they are needed.


Do you believe you have what it takes to become our new Marketing Analyst ? If so, we offer you a very stimulating job in an international and expansive company where your skills, ambitions and determination will decide your future. You will have the opportunity to work in an organization where the time from an idea to action is short.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
📊 ¿Te apasiona el mundo del análisis de datos? ¡Tu oportunidad está aquí!




Desde Selecta Digital, estamos buscando 🔎 un Analista de Datos (H/M) 🚀 para un cliente final del sector Seguros 👨‍💻




La empresa tiene una misión muy clara: diseñar y ofrecer servicios de previsión que permitan mejorar la calidad de vida de las personas.




Es el reto profesional que, con tu pasión y conocimiento, puede suponer el salto profesional que estas buscando. Desde Selecta, ¡te acompañaremos en todo el proceso de selección!




🚀 ¿Qué harás en tu día a día?




Crear y mantener informes y cuadros de mando con IBM Cognos y Power BI.
Desarrollar modelos de datos para facilitar el análisis personalizado.
Diseñar dashboards para la Dirección General con indicadores clave (KPI's).
Colaborar con equipos internos para garantizar la calidad y accesibilidad de los datos.




🕵️‍♀️ ¿Qué buscamos en ti?




Grado en Estadística, Matemáticas, Informática, Ingeniería o similar.
Al menos 1 año de experiencia con IBM Cognos y Power BI.
Conocimientos básicos de SQL y bases de datos relacionales.
Valorable experiencia con herramientas de análisis de datos avanzadas (ETL, Data Warehousing).
Pasión por el dato, curiosidad y ganas de aprender.




¿Qué ofrecemos? 🌟




💰 Salario según perfil. ¡¡Cuéntanos tus expectativas!!

💼 Horario intensivo y flexible (37,5 horas/semana)

📍 Presencial Barcelona.

📈 Plan de carrera y formación continua.

🌴 28 días de vacaciones.

🛠️ Descuentos en seguros y plan de jubilación.

✅ Paquete de retribución flexible y otros beneficios.




📩 ¿Te interesa? ¡No dejes pasar esta oportunidad!




Aplica ahora o comparte esta oferta con alguien que pueda encajar. 🚀




¡Esperamos tu postulación! ☺




Tanto Selecta como nuestros clientes estamos comprometidos con la igualdad de oportunidades y nos discriminamos por razón de edad, raza, religión o sexo.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Freelance Data Analyst (8-Month Contract)

Location: Amstelveen, Netherlands (2 Days in Office, 3 Days Remote)

Contract Duration: 8 Months




About the Company:

Our client, an innovative company in Aviation, seeks a Data Analyst to support data-driven decision-making in a collaborative, flexible environment.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyze and process large datasets to inform business decisions.
Create reports, dashboards, and visualizations to present insights.
Identify trends and KPIs to optimize processes.
Collaborate with teams to define and implement data solutions.
Conduct data validation and ensure consistency.
Provide ad-hoc analytical support and help maintain automated reporting tools.




Key Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, or related field.
Proven experience in data analysis and reporting tools (SQL, Excel, Python, R).
Proficiency in data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI).
Strong attention to detail and ability to communicate findings clearly.
Experience with business intelligence tools or cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) is a plus.
Fluent Dutch




What We Offer:

Hybrid work model (2 days in the office, 3 days remote).
Collaborative team environment.
Competitive compensation.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Junior Data Analyst

Job Location: IFSC Dublin 1

Department: Regulatory Reporting

Reports to: Regulatory Reporting Manager

Ava Trade is Financial Institution based in Dublin City Center offices in IFSC, Dublin 1. We are currently seeking to recruit Data Analyst to join our Regulatory reporting department, with responsibilities of the Data Analyst will collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide actionable insights for regulatory reporting. The role will involve identifying trends, patterns, and correlations in data, creating reports, and delivering key metrics to drive performance improvements of multiple client asset reconciliation and trading transaction reporting, the determination and resolution reporting discrepancies and participating in the implementation of forensic and enhanced governance and compliance procedures by the deployment of advance IT and BI system, this role will require 39 hours per Week. 9-6pm from Monday to Friday.

Reporting to the Regulation reporting Manager, this position will have the following responsibilities:


Transaction Reporting:
Data Collection & Preparation: Gather and clean data from multiple sources to ensure its accuracy and completeness.
Data Analysis: Perform statistical analysis, generate reports, and derive insights to inform business decisions.
Report Generation: Create dashboards, visualizations, and regular reports, summarizing key trends, performance metrics and insights.
Data Visualization: Use tools like Tableau, Power BI, or Excel to create clear, impactful data visualizations.
Predictive Analysis: Develop predictive models using historical data to forecast future trends and outcomes.
Collaboration: Work with different departments (e.g., Dealing desk, IT, BI, operations and Finance) to understand data requirements and deliver actionable insights.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvement, data automation, and optimization to enhance analytical capabilities.


Client Asset / Capital Requirement Reconciliation:
Responsible for the day-to-day administration and reconciliation of multiple Client Asset Reconciliation
Research and resolve any discrepancies
Liaising directly with the relevant team internally or externally to resolve any queries
Compiling of periodical reports and monitoring of reporting data qualities
Assisting in the implementation of enhanced administration and control procedures
Ongoing financial support services to the Management Team including providing analyses and reports on activity

To be considered for this position, applicants will meet the following requirements:


1-2 Years experience in a busy reconciliations or Data analysis environment, credit management or investment firms.
A strong attention to detail
Familiarity with statistical analysis and tools.
Experience with data visualization software (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, Python etc


Key Skills And Competencies:


Analytical Thinking: Ability to analyze large datasets and extract meaningful patterns and trends.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in SQL and database querying.
Knowledge of statistical techniques (e.g., regression, hypothesis testing).
Expertise in Excel for advanced data manipulation and modeling.
Experience with programming languages such for data analysis and automation.
Attention to Detail: Strong attention to data accuracy and precision.
Communication Skills: Ability to present complex data in a clear and understandable manner to non-technical stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: Ability to identify issues, analyze root causes, and offer actionable solutions.

Benefits:

bike to work, taxsaver. Pension Fund Paid Holidays VHI

Preferred Qualifications:


Experience in machine learning or AI applications for data analysis.
Certification in data analytics or related fields, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or related field.
3rd level degree or above


Skills:

Excel, SQL, Python, Tableau, Power BI

Benefits:

Pension Fund Paid Holidays health insurance Gym

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
Buscamos ampliar nuestro equipo con un/a Analista de datos para incorporarse a nuestro equipo en Sevilla, cuyas funciones son:




• Proporcionar información procesable y de gran impacto a cualquier área del cliente y resolver cuestiones empresariales con datos.

• Alineación con la nueva estrategia de datos.

• Colaboración con un conjunto diverso de partes de la empresa para ayudar en la toma de las decisiones empresariales correctas y mejorar continuamente sus procesos y adoptar un enfoque innovador.

• Análisis de datos en profundidad para obtener ideas y recomendaciones empresariales.

• Generación de cuadros de mando e informes. Storytelling.

• Propuestas proactivas de casos de uso que generen valor a nuestros negocios.

• Explotación de Big Data y bases de datos relacionales.

• Inspección, limpieza, transformación y modelado de datos.

• Análisis de datos complejos de múltiples fuentes. Deep analysis.

• Análisis y definición de KPIs para identificar oportunidades de negocio y alcanzar OKRs.




Requisitos:




• Mentalidad orientada al negocio. Visión de negocio avanzada.

• Experiencia trabajando directamente con usuarios de negocio para construir informes, cuadros de mando y resolver preguntas de negocio con datos.

• Conocimientos avanzados de Excel

• Conocimientos avanzados de visualización de datos (Power BI)

• Conocimientos de SAP- SAP BW

• Conocimientos avanzados Office 365

• trabajar de forma independiente una vez que se le da una dirección.

• Dominio del inglés (C1)

Title: Analista de Datos
Description:
En Iberostar Group estamos buscando a un/a Analista ESG para unirse a nuestro equipo de Finanzas en nuestra Sede Central en Palma, pero antes de saber más sobre la posición creemos que es importante que sepas un poco sobre Iberostar Group:




Somos una empresa 100% familiar (Concretamente, una familia de más de 30.000 empleados/as).
Tenemos presencia en 35 países y nuestras oficinas centrales están en Palma de Mallorca.
Nuestros valores (Pasión, Responsabilidad, Transparencia, Creatividad y Humildad) son muy importantes para nosotros, todas nuestras acciones que llevamos a cabo van acorde a ellos.
Somos pioneros en turismo responsable (Revisa nuestro movimiento Wave of Change para saber más).




Si esto te resulta interesante... puede que este sea tu sitio!




Misión del puesto: apoyar al ESG Data & Reporting Director en la planificación, ejecución y seguimiento de proyectos enfocados en asegurar el cumplimiento con las normativas y estándares de reporting sostenible. Serás responsable de coordinar y analizar datos relacionados con ESG, colaborar con diferentes áreas de negocio y participar en la implementación de herramientas para la gestión y el control de información ESG.




¿Cuales serán tus funciones?




Participar activamente en la elaboración de la memoria de sostenibilidad, desde la recopilación de datos hasta la redacción y revisión del informe.
Coordinar y dar seguimiento a las reuniones con áreas de negocio y consultores externos, asegurando una comunicación eficiente y la alineación con los objetivos del proyecto.
Realizar el análisis de datos ESG reportados, asegurando la calidad, trazabilidad y coherencia de la información.
Colaborar en proyectos de gestión de datos ESG y en la implementación de herramientas tecnológicas que optimicen los procesos de recopilación y reporting.
Apoyar en el mantenimiento y optimización del aplicativo de reporting ESG (Workiva), garantizando la calidad de los datos reportados y la funcionalidad del sistema para los usuarios.
Participar en la implementación de nuevas herramientas de control y gestión para mejorar la precisión y la eficiencia del reporting de datos ESG.




¿Qué buscamos en ti?




Gestión, participación o colaboración en proyectos transversales que involucren distintas áreas de negocio, especialmente en la elaboración de memorias sostenibles.
Participación en proyectos de integración de datos o implementación de aplicaciones para la gestión de información.
Conocimientos en sostenibilidad (factores ambientales, sociales y de buen gobierno corporativo).
Capacidad analítica y habilidad para comunicar de manera efectiva la información a diferentes niveles de la organización.
Nivel alto de inglés
Competencias técnicas en el manejo de Excel, Google Sheets, Power BI y Google Slides. Se valorarán conocimientos en Workiva.




¿Qué beneficios tendrás?




Smart Working: Flexibilidad horaria y modalidad de trabajo híbrida con dos días de teletrabajo semanales.
Formación continua a través de planes formativos y de Iberostar Campus, nuestra plataforma de aprendizaje donde te podrás nutrir de formaciones específicas y globales.
Un paquete de atractivos beneficios como: Afterworks, descuentos en todos nuestros hoteles y en otros servicios y productos como seguro de salud, viajes, ocio y mucho más.
Ser miembro de la Comunidad Iberostar Vitality (nuestro programa de empresa saludable y de bienestar para el empleado que incluye clases de yoga semanales, gimnasio virtual, planes nutricionales, día de la fruta, etc. ).
Trabajar en un entorno inspirador que apuesta por las personas, los valores y un modelo de turismo responsable.




¡Nos encantaría proporcionarte más información sobre la posición y conocer más sobre tu perfil y expectativas! #WEAREIBEROSTAR 🌟

Title: CDI - Data Analyst Growth et Monétisation TF1+ F/H
Description:
A propos




La Direction BtoC a pour ambition de développer la plateforme de streaming gratuite leader sur le divertissement familial et l’information pour les francophones.

Cette nouvelle ambition, stratégique pour le Groupe, implique de passer sur l’ensemble des sujets d’un service de rattrapage à une plateforme de streaming / destination. Notre offre est amenée à profondément évoluer que ce soit le produit, l’infrastructure tech, le marketing digital (acquisition et engagement des utilisateurs dans tous les environnements OTT, FAI, TV connectées), le marketing éditorial, les formats publicitaires ainsi que notre organisation et les profils de l’équipe.

Sur le plan digital, TF1+ s’établit comme leader en couverture avec 33 millions de streamers mensuels en moyenne au premier trimestre, et 35,4 millions en mai, un nouveau record, en comparaison des 28 millions de streamers mensuels pour MYTF1 en 2023. Au premier trimestre 2024, la plateforme enregistre 285 millions d’heures streamées (+13% par rapport au premier trimestre 2023) selon Médiamétrie, qui intègre les environnements où subsiste MYTF1, tant que TF1+ n’y est pas encore distribué. Sur les environnements où la nouvelle plateforme est disponible, la consommation est en forte progression de 79%.

Nous recherchons un Data Analyst Growth et Monétisation en CDI pour intervenir sur les sujets liés à l’enrichissement du catalogue de la plateforme de streaming TF1+




Votre Terrain de Jeu




Au sein du service « Pilotage de la performance » et rattaché au Lead Data Growth et Monétisation, vous êtes en charge des analyses permettant de soutenir les équipes B2C dans l’élaboration de leur plan d’actions. Vos missions seront les suivantes :

Aider à piloter les performances de TF1+ via les indicateurs clés de reach (volume de streamers), d’usages (heures visionnées, fréquence d’activité) et de monétisation (ARPU), et en expliquer les évolutions au regard du plan annuel défini.
Contribuer à faire avancer la vision business chez TF1, en travaillant notamment sur la notion de cycle de vie des utilisateurs et utilisatrices, et la compréhension des usages individuels.
Soutenir les équipes Marketing Growth et Engagement dans l’élaboration de leur plan d’action à travers la compréhension des performances de leurs campagnes d’acquisition et de fidélisation, et rationaliser l'impact des actions métiers (CRM, Réseaux sociaux...) en développant des modèles de contribution.




Soutenir les équipes Marketing des Offres dans l’identification des poches de valeur prioritaires.
Être en lien avec les squads produit pour évaluer les impacts des développements produits.
Soutenir l’équipe Partenariats Stratégiques et la Régie Publicitaire dans l’accélération de la dataïsation de nos streamers.
Contribuer à élaborer le plan d’accélération digitale.




Match :




Vous témoignez d’une première expérience solide en tant que data analyst d'au moins 2 ans, en lien avec les équipes Marketing et d'autres équipes métiers (produit, marketing, éditorial ou stratégique).
Vous avez déjà réalisé des études de performance business portant notamment sur la compréhension de la valeur, de l’acquisition et de la rétention client.
Vous savez traduire un besoin en brief, mais aussi proposer des solutions face à un problème et restituer des analyses à un public non averti.
Vous êtes intéressé par les Médias.
Vous êtes autonome, structuré et force de proposition.
Vous savez travailler en équipe et êtes à l'aise à l'oral.
Vous maîtrisez les outils de mesure site-centric (Piano Analytics).
Vous êtes rigoureux.se dans vos analyses.
Vous avez la capacité à prendre de la hauteur sur les enjeux business.

Vous maîtrisez le langage SQL (Python est un plus).

Rejoindre le Groupe TF1




C’est prendre part à des projets ambitieux au cœur de la roadmap stratégique du premier groupe audiovisuel privé, leader de la télévision en France avec 5 chaines gratuites et 3 chaines thématiques sur la télévision payante (TF1, TMC, TMX, TF1 SERIES FILMS, LCI, TV BREIZH, HISTOIRE, USHUAIA TV), ainsi que des services de médias audiovisuels à la demande (TF1+, TFOU MAX…) pour en faire la destination de référence pour le divertissement et l’info en France.




C’est faire partie d’un Groupe de l'événement, des émotions et du direct. TF1 propose une programmation diverse et familiale dans les domaines de l’information, du divertissement, de la fiction, du cinéma et des documentaires.




C’est également travailler à la production et la distribution de contenus, notamment via les filiales du Groupe TF1 PRODUCTION, TF1 FILMS PRODUCTION et NEWEN.




C’est enfin réaliser des projets qui se voient, et qui impactent directement la vie de millions de personnes, au sein d’une entreprise consciente de sa responsabilité sociétale et environnementale. En effet, le groupe TF1 s’engage pour participer à la construction d’une société plus solidaire, plus inclusive et plus durable.




Sur le plan social, le Groupe agit activement en faveur de l’égalité femme-homme, au sein des équipes comme sur les plateaux télévisés. Il promeut également la diversité et l’inclusion dans le recrutement, le management des talents, mais aussi sur l’ensemble de ses chaînes.

Sur le plan environnemental, le Groupe est engagé dans une trajectoire de décarbonation avec des objectifs validés par le SBTi, et tâche de favoriser la publicité responsable, mais aussi de sensibiliser ses publics à la transition écologique, tant au travers de ses programmes d’information que des fictions ou séries quotidiennes.




A la clé




Un environnement de travail et une culture d’entreprise permettant à tous les profils de s’épanouir au quotidien.

Des espaces qui allient confort et praticité

95% des collaborateurs jugent l’aménagement des locaux pleinement satisfaisant 👍 (enquête interne 2022), et 81% pensent que nos espaces en flex-office favorisent une bonne ambiance
Espaces flex, terrasses végétalisées ou télétravail : c’est à la carte.
Sur place ou à emporter : des repas healthy, variés et subventionnés au restaurant d’entreprise ou à la cafétéria, mais aussi le plein de services trop pratiques (parking, atelier réparation vélo, permanence mutuelle, opticien…)

Une culture all-inclusive

56% de femmes dans le Groupe, 30% dans les équipes Tech, et une envie forte d’aller encore plus loin
Une Mission Handicap qui agit chaque jour pour garantir le respect de la singularité de chacun en proposant un accompagnement sur mesure aux collaborateurs concernés par un handicap, ainsi qu’à leur manager !

Training

Pour le corps, grâce à nos 17 associations sportives (football, volleyball, krav maga, running, etc.), et notre salle de sport subventionnée à moins de 100 mètres
Pour l’esprit, avec des formations pour se mettre à jour en permanence (75% des collaborateurs formés en 2023), et un accompagnement de carrière sur-mesure

+1 👶

Le Groupe TF1 propose à l’ensemble des collaborateurs une flexibilité en matière d’organisation du temps de travail avant le congé maternité, et un suivi professionnel au retour
Le salaire est maintenu à 100% pour les collaborateurs concernés par la prise totale ou partielle d’un congé paternité / second parent, et ce, durant 28 jours
Une prise en charge partielle des modes de garde est proposée

Et parce que le nombre de caractères est limité, on sera ravis de vous présenter les différents plans d’épargne entreprise, les congés spéciaux, la mutuelle d’entreprise, les forfaits mobilité ou encore le CSE lors de notre prochain échange !

La suite ?




Si votre CV est sélectionné,

1- Échange téléphonique avec notre Talent Acquisition Specialist

2- Entretien avec le manager et notre Talent Acquisition Specialist

3- Entretien sur site/visio avec le Directeur du pôle

4- Entretien sur site/visio avec le responsable RH




Durée estimée du process : 4 semaines

HTML:
A propos


La Direction BtoC a pour ambition de développer la plateforme de streaming gratuite leader sur le divertissement familial et l’information pour les francophones.

Cette nouvelle ambition, stratégique pour le Groupe, implique de passer sur l’ensemble des sujets d’un service de rattrapage à une plateforme de streaming / destination. Notre offre est amenée à profondément évoluer que ce soit le produit, l’infrastructure tech, le marketing digital (acquisition et engagement des utilisateurs dans tous les environnements OTT, FAI, TV connectées), le marketing éditorial, les formats publicitaires ainsi que notre organisation et les profils de l’équipe.

Sur le plan digital, TF1+ s’établit comme leader en couverture avec 33 millions de streamers mensuels en moyenne au premier trimestre, et 35,4 millions en mai, un nouveau record, en comparaison des 28 millions de streamers mensuels pour MYTF1 en 2023. Au premier trimestre 2024, la plateforme enregistre 285 millions d’heures streamées (+13% par rapport au premier trimestre 2023) selon Médiamétrie, qui intègre les environnements où subsiste MYTF1, tant que TF1+ n’y est pas encore distribué. Sur les environnements où la nouvelle plateforme est disponible, la consommation est en forte progression de 79%.

Nous recherchons un Data Analyst Growth et Monétisation en CDI pour intervenir sur les sujets liés à l’enrichissement du catalogue de la plateforme de streaming TF1+


Votre Terrain de Jeu


Au sein du service « Pilotage de la performance » et rattaché au Lead Data Growth et Monétisation, vous êtes en charge des analyses permettant de soutenir les équipes B2C dans l’élaboration de leur plan d’actions. Vos missions seront les suivantes :

  • Aider à piloter les performances de TF1+ via les indicateurs clés de reach (volume de streamers), d’usages (heures visionnées, fréquence d’activité) et de monétisation (ARPU), et en expliquer les évolutions au regard du plan annuel défini.
  • Contribuer à faire avancer la vision business chez TF1, en travaillant notamment sur la notion de cycle de vie des utilisateurs et utilisatrices, et la compréhension des usages individuels.
  • Soutenir les équipes Marketing Growth et Engagement dans l’élaboration de leur plan d’action à travers la compréhension des performances de leurs campagnes d’acquisition et de fidélisation, et rationaliser l'impact des actions métiers (CRM, Réseaux sociaux...) en développant des modèles de contribution.


  • Soutenir les équipes Marketing des Offres dans l’identification des poches de valeur prioritaires.
  • Être en lien avec les squads produit pour évaluer les impacts des développements produits.
  • Soutenir l’équipe Partenariats Stratégiques et la Régie Publicitaire dans l’accélération de la dataïsation de nos streamers.
  • Contribuer à élaborer le plan d’accélération digitale.


Match :


  • Vous témoignez d’une première expérience solide en tant que data analyst d'au moins 2 ans, en lien avec les équipes Marketing et d'autres équipes métiers (produit, marketing, éditorial ou stratégique).
  • Vous avez déjà réalisé des études de performance business portant notamment sur la compréhension de la valeur, de l’acquisition et de la rétention client.
  • Vous savez traduire un besoin en brief, mais aussi proposer des solutions face à un problème et restituer des analyses à un public non averti.
  • Vous êtes intéressé par les Médias.
  • Vous êtes autonome, structuré et force de proposition.
  • Vous savez travailler en équipe et êtes à l'aise à l'oral.
  • Vous maîtrisez les outils de mesure site-centric (Piano Analytics).
  • Vous êtes rigoureux.se dans vos analyses.
  • Vous avez la capacité à prendre de la hauteur sur les enjeux business.

Vous maîtrisez le langage SQL (Python est un plus).

Rejoindre le Groupe TF1


C’est prendre part à des projets ambitieux au cœur de la roadmap stratégique du premier groupe audiovisuel privé, leader de la télévision en France avec 5 chaines gratuites et 3 chaines thématiques sur la télévision payante (TF1, TMC, TMX, TF1 SERIES FILMS, LCI, TV BREIZH, HISTOIRE, USHUAIA TV), ainsi que des services de médias audiovisuels à la demande (TF1+, TFOU MAX…) pour en faire la destination de référence pour le divertissement et l’info en France.


C’est faire partie d’un Groupe de l'événement, des émotions et du direct. TF1 propose une programmation diverse et familiale dans les domaines de l’information, du divertissement, de la fiction, du cinéma et des documentaires.


C’est également travailler à la production et la distribution de contenus, notamment via les filiales du Groupe TF1 PRODUCTION, TF1 FILMS PRODUCTION et NEWEN.


C’est enfin réaliser des projets qui se voient, et qui impactent directement la vie de millions de personnes, au sein d’une entreprise consciente de sa responsabilité sociétale et environnementale. En effet, le groupe TF1 s’engage pour participer à la construction d’une société plus solidaire, plus inclusive et plus durable.


Sur le plan social, le Groupe agit activement en faveur de l’égalité femme-homme, au sein des équipes comme sur les plateaux télévisés. Il promeut également la diversité et l’inclusion dans le recrutement, le management des talents, mais aussi sur l’ensemble de ses chaînes.

Sur le plan environnemental, le Groupe est engagé dans une trajectoire de décarbonation avec des objectifs validés par le SBTi, et tâche de favoriser la publicité responsable, mais aussi de sensibiliser ses publics à la transition écologique, tant au travers de ses programmes d’information que des fictions ou séries quotidiennes.


A la clé


Un environnement de travail et une culture d’entreprise permettant à tous les profils de s’épanouir au quotidien.

  • Espaces flex, terrasses végétalisées ou télétravail : c’est à la carte.
  • Sur place ou à emporter : des repas healthy, variés et subventionnés au restaurant d’entreprise ou à la cafétéria, mais aussi le plein de services trop pratiques (parking, atelier réparation vélo, permanence mutuelle, opticien…)

Une culture all-inclusive

  • 56% de femmes dans le Groupe, 30% dans les équipes Tech, et une envie forte d’aller encore plus loin
  • Une Mission Handicap qui agit chaque jour pour garantir le respect de la singularité de chacun en proposant un accompagnement sur mesure aux collaborateurs concernés par un handicap, ainsi qu’à leur manager !

Training

  • Pour le corps, grâce à nos 17 associations sportives (football, volleyball, krav maga, running, etc.), et notre salle de sport subventionnée à moins de 100 mètres
  • Pour l’esprit, avec des formations pour se mettre à jour en permanence (75% des collaborateurs formés en 2023), et un accompagnement de carrière sur-mesure

+1 👶

  • Le Groupe TF1 propose à l’ensemble des collaborateurs une flexibilité en matière d’organisation du temps de travail avant le congé maternité, et un suivi professionnel au retour
  • Le salaire est maintenu à 100% pour les collaborateurs concernés par la prise totale ou partielle d’un congé paternité / second parent, et ce, durant 28 jours
  • Une prise en charge partielle des modes de garde est proposée

Et parce que le nombre de caractères est limité, on sera ravis de vous présenter les différents plans d’épargne entreprise, les congés spéciaux, la mutuelle d’entreprise, les forfaits mobilité ou encore le CSE lors de notre prochain échange !

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Com mais de uma década de experiência no mercado, a Human Profiler é uma consultora especializada em Outsourcing de IT e em Processos de Recrutamento e Seleção de Perfis Qualificados. Atuamos com total flexibilidade, adaptando-nos às necessidades dos nossos clientes e parceiros. Procuramos um(a) Data Analyst para integrar a nossa equipa.




Principais responsabilidades:

Definição dos KPIs de acompanhamento negócio/produto
Elaboração\definição de Dashboard/reporting acompanhamento negócio/produto
Exploração de dados para procura de valor para o negócio

Requisitos:

Licenciatura em Economia, Estatística, Matemática, Gestão ou similar
Pós-Graduação em Data Science (preferencial)
Experiência mínima de 5 anos enquanto Data Analyst
Conhecimentos em Power BI, MicroStrategy ou tecnologia similar...
Conhecimentos técnicos de SQL
Experiência/conhecimentos da Área Bancária e/ou Pagamentos (preferencial)
Excelentes capacidades comunicacionais e de apresentação
Forte pensamento crítico e habilidades de resolução de problemas
Capacidade de trabalhar de forma independente e em equipa

O que oferecemos:

Projeto dinâmico num cliente reconhecido a nível nacional/ internacional
Enquadramento salarial competitivo, de acordo com a experiência demonstrada
Oportunidades de evolução de carreira em projetos tecnológicos desafiantes
Integração numa equipa dinâmica e heterogénea
Acompanhamento personalizado
Formação contínua
Seguro de saúde
Eventos corporativos e ações de team building
Benefícios exclusivos através da nossa rede de parcerias (saúde, bem-estar, viagens, gastronomia, cultura, lazer, formação, etc).




Processo de recrutamento, seleção e integração:

O processo inicia-se com contacto telefónico ou por videoconferência. Garantimos acompanhamento completo durante a integração, para apoiar o desenvolvimento de carreira dos nossos novos colaboradores.

Envie a sua candidatura, com o CV atualizado e a referência Data Analyst, para recrutamento@humanprofiler.com.

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Arcaplanet consolida la sua leadership e la sua strategia di crescita con l’apertura di decine di nuovi punti vendita ogni anno su tutto il territorio nazionale, con lo sviluppo del canale on line e di tutte le formule digitali in logica omnichannel integrata e con lo sviluppo dell’offerta di nuovi servizi dedicati ai Pet.

A supporto di tale strategia e con un forte orientamento customer centric, investe nello sviluppo delle professionalità che operano sia nel Retail che nell’Headquarter con l’obiettivo costante di garantire la massima soddisfazione ed un servizio di eccellenza.


In questo contesto di riferimento, cerchiamo un/una:


BUSINESS DATA ANALYST


Stiamo ricercando un/a risorsa il cui compito sarà quello di supportare il team e-commerce nella gestione dei dati al fine di migliorare l’esperienza di acquisto del cliente.

Principali responsabilità

  • Raccoglierai e analizzerai i dati aziendali per identificare tendenze, opportunità e problemi;
  • Utilizzerai strumenti di data visualization come Tableau, Power BI per creare report e dashboard interattivi e informativi;
  • Fornirai analisi approfondite per supportare le decisioni aziendali e le strategie di crescita;
  • Monitorerai le performance dell'e-commerce e fornirai suggerimenti per migliorare l'esperienza del cliente e ottimizzare i processi di vendita;
  • Identificherai le sfide operative e suggerirai soluzioni per migliorare l'efficienza aziendale;
  • Collaborerai con i colleghi per raggiungere obiettivi comuni e misurerai i risultati in base alle metriche prestabilite.



Requisiti richiesti


  • Almeno 2 anni di esperienza come Business Analyst o ruoli simili;
  • Competenza avanzata nell'utilizzo di Tableau,
  • Power BI e Excel per l'analisi e la visualizzazione dei dati;
  • Conoscenza di pacchetti statistici come Excel,SPSS e strumenti ETL;
  • Esperienza su piattaforma Salesforce Cloud Platform e delle sue dinamiche;
  • Conoscenza di SQL, data warehouse, business intelligence e linguaggi di programmazione come R, Python;
  • Conoscenza delle dinamiche di un e-commerce e delle principali metriche di business;
  • Capacità di lavorare in modo autonomo e in team, con orientamento agli obiettivi;
  • Proattività nel proporre nuove idee e soluzioni innovative;
  • Ottima capacità comunicativa e di presentazione per comunicare gli insights ai diversi stakeholder;
  • Buone capacità analitiche e di problem-solving;
  • Spirito di apprendimento costante e desiderio di mantenere un'aggiornata conoscenza delle tendenze del settore.


Cosa Offriamo:


Offriamo un ambiente molto dinamico e flessibile in un’azienda leader, in costante crescita e con un mercato in forte evoluzione;

Benefits e pacchetto retributivo da valutare sulla base dell’esperienza del candidato;

Smart working

# Siamo attenti al pianeta, alle nostre persone e ai nostri amici animali.


Sede di lavoro: Milano.

E' richiesta la disponibilità a trasferte nell'Headquarter di Carasco (Genova).


Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.







At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join us in Porto.




Requirements:

Information systems background.
Knowledge of Application design and Data Visualization modeling.
Knowledge of ETL Processes and some experinece wih Python
Databases / SQL language and Data Modeling.
Data Visualization / Restitution tools experience - Power BI.
Fluency in spoken English.




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to goncalo.delgado@decskill.com with reference “GD / DAP”.




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Accelerate your development and exposure to high performance applications and cloud infrastructure. Join Faptic Technology, a fast-growing scale-up organization with an ambition to be recognized as one of the leading technology companies in Romania.

Our global client base needs builders: engineers and developers who love technology, have deep expertise in software and cloud technologies, and importantly, have a passion for culture and customers.


We obsess about our customers
We build outstanding technical solutions
We create an awesome culture
We accelerate learning and careers


As a Junior Data Analyst, you will join a team who deals with cutting-edge technologies every day and strives to utilize integration services to their limits. You will be taking part in Solution and Architectural designs as well as introducing and proposing new methods and technologies through well tested Proof-of-Concepts. You will Design, develop and deploy pipelines, create snaps and extract data in various downstream applications. You will develop interfaces, troubleshoot and fix integration issues.

Your activities will include:


Work extensively with SQL databases to analyze, manage, and retrieve data
Receive mentorship and support for continuous technical learning and development
Analyze functional specifications/user stories and translate them into detailed technical requirements
Research and evaluate new technologies and solutions to enhance analytical capabilities
Develop and implement Proof of Concepts, guiding solutions through their complete life cycle
Design, develop, and deploy data pipelines for efficient data processing and management
Create custom snaps and extract data for use in various downstream applications
Develop and maintain integration interfaces, including troubleshooting and resolving any integration issues
Contribute to policy and procedure development (e.g., cloud adoption) and create documentation and user guides



Requirements


University degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a similar discipline
At least 2 years of experience in working with databases / SQL
Knowledge of ETL design principles is a plus
Knowledge or previous experience in solution design
Strong organizational, communicational and documentation skills
Self-motivated, detail-oriented, strong team player
English is a must



Benefits


Private medical insurance 
Training on market trends and client needs 
Continuous personal improvement - 8h/month during work hours 
Lunch on Friday (twice per month, we pay)
21 days annual leave, with one day per year extra up to 25 days 
3 days sick leave without medical proof off
1 day for your Birthday off 
0.5 days Christmas Shopping off 
Competitive salary package
Quarterly fun budget for team events 
Show more
HTML:
Accelerate your development and exposure to high performance applications and cloud infrastructure. Join Faptic Technology, a fast-growing scale-up organization with an ambition to be recognized as one of the leading technology companies in Romania.

Our global client base needs builders: engineers and developers who love technology, have deep expertise in software and cloud technologies, and importantly, have a passion for culture and customers.

  • We obsess about our customers
  • We build outstanding technical solutions
  • We create an awesome culture
  • We accelerate learning and careers

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will join a team who deals with cutting-edge technologies every day and strives to utilize integration services to their limits. You will be taking part in Solution and Architectural designs as well as introducing and proposing new methods and technologies through well tested Proof-of-Concepts. You will Design, develop and deploy pipelines, create snaps and extract data in various downstream applications. You will develop interfaces, troubleshoot and fix integration issues.

Your activities will include:

  • Work extensively with SQL databases to analyze, manage, and retrieve data
  • Receive mentorship and support for continuous technical learning and development
  • Analyze functional specifications/user stories and translate them into detailed technical requirements
  • Research and evaluate new technologies and solutions to enhance analytical capabilities
  • Develop and implement Proof of Concepts, guiding solutions through their complete life cycle
  • Design, develop, and deploy data pipelines for efficient data processing and management
  • Create custom snaps and extract data for use in various downstream applications
  • Develop and maintain integration interfaces, including troubleshooting and resolving any integration issues
  • Contribute to policy and procedure development (e.g., cloud adoption) and create documentation and user guides


Requirements

  • University degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a similar discipline
  • At least 2 years of experience in working with databases / SQL
  • Knowledge of ETL design principles is a plus
  • Knowledge or previous experience in solution design
  • Strong organizational, communicational and documentation skills
  • Self-motivated, detail-oriented, strong team player
  • English is a must


Benefits

  • Private medical insurance 
  • Training on market trends and client needs 
  • Continuous personal improvement - 8h/month during work hours 
  • Lunch on Friday (twice per month, we pay)
  • 21 days annual leave, with one day per year extra up to 25 days 
  • 3 days sick leave without medical proof off
  • 1 day for your Birthday off 
  • 0.5 days Christmas Shopping off 
  • Competitive salary package
  • Quarterly fun budget for team events

Title: Analista dati
Place: Metropolitan City of Bologna, Emilia-Romagna, Italy
Description:
Il nostro cliente è un'azienda del settore dell'Energy Management, operante nel campo della consulenza e dei servizi per le imprese. Per la sede di BOLOGNA ricerchiamo una figura di:




DATA ANALYST




La risorsa, inserita all'interno del team Operations, si occuperà di:




Supportare il team di relazione e sviluppo nell'interfacciarsi con i clienti per la raccolta dati e la produzione di reportistica;
Utilizzare operativamente i sistemi informatici aziendali, in particolare le funzioni di CRM, fatturazione e ticketing: analisi dei dati di fatturazione delle utenze power e gas, predisposizione di reportistiche periodiche, analisi dei consumi energetici ed elaborazione di simulazioni di spesa, predisposizione di report di fatturazione delle ricariche delle colonnine elettriche;
·Collaborare con altre aree aziendali per la corretta interpretazione ed applicazione della normativa di settore, in particolare per le attività di aggiornamento dei corrispettivi di fatturazione;
·Supportare il team di Back-office & Operations nella gestione dei principali processi di back-office del settore energia & gas (es. richieste di switch e connessione e attività di customer service).




Requisiti




Desideriamo entrare in contatto con candidatə in possesso dei seguenti requisiti:




Laurea magistrale in Economia, Statistica, Matematica, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini;
Ottima conoscenza della Suite Microsoft 365, in particolare Excel;
Capacità di elaborare, manipolare e interpretare grandi quantità di dati;




Altre informazioni

Si offre inserimento diretto in azienda mediante contratto a tempo indeterminato e retribuzione commisurata all'esperienza, oltre ad un interessante sistema di welfare aziendale.

Orario: full time

Modalità: ibrida

Sede di lavoro: Bologna




L'offerta è rivolta a candidatə nel rispetto del Dlgs 198/2006 e dei Dlgs 215/2003 e 216/2003.

Le persone interessate sono invitate a leggere l'informativa privacy ex artt. 13 e 14 del Reg. UE 2016/679.

Aut. Min. Prot. N. 1207 – SG del 16/12/2004

Candidati per questo annuncio

Title: Data Analyst - Smart Cities
Description:
Data Analyst – AI/LLM (Entry-Mid Level)

Location: Berlin, Germany | Salary: €50,000 – €65,000 per year + Benefits




Our client, a pioneer in smart cities and urban innovation, is seeking a motivated Data Analyst to join their Berlin team. This is a unique opportunity to work with cutting-edge AI and large language models (LLMs) to reshape how cities operate and evolve. From optimizing urban mobility to enhancing energy efficiency, you’ll be part of a team creating the cities of the future.




About the Role

You’ll play a vital role in analyzing and refining data from AI-powered solutions tailored to smart city applications. These solutions integrate real-time data on transportation, energy consumption, public services, and environmental metrics to provide actionable insights for urban planners, policymakers, and city operators.




Responsibilities

Analyze and interpret large datasets related to urban systems, including transportation networks, energy grids, and environmental monitoring.
Collaborate with AI and engineering teams to improve the accuracy and functionality of LLMs applied to smart city challenges.
Develop predictive models and dashboards to support decision-making for urban development and sustainability goals.
Conduct experiments and A/B testing to enhance user engagement and optimize system performance.
Present insights to stakeholders, including city governments and private partners, to support strategic initiatives.




What You’ll Need

Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Urban Planning, Computer Science, or related fields.
Technical Expertise: Proficiency in Python, SQL, or R; familiarity with geospatial tools (e.g., GIS) and AI/ML frameworks is highly desirable.
Industry Knowledge: A keen interest in smart cities, urban planning, or sustainability-focused industries.
Analytical Skills: Ability to draw meaningful insights from complex datasets and present findings tailored to urban applications.
Experience Level: 1–3 years in data analysis, ideally within urban systems or technology projects.
Language Skills: Fluency in English is essential; German is a strong advantage.




Salary & Benefits

Competitive salary: €50,000 – €65,000 per year, depending on experience.
Benefits include comprehensive health insurance, flexible working hours, and professional development opportunities.
Hybrid work environment based in Berlin, with remote work options.
The chance to work on impactful projects that are shaping the future of urban living.




Why Join?

This is your opportunity to merge your data expertise with a passion for innovation in urban environments. You’ll be joining a forward-thinking team that’s leveraging AI to tackle some of the most pressing challenges facing modern cities, from traffic congestion to carbon emissions.




How to Apply

If this exciting role sounds like a match for your skills and aspirations, we’d love to hear from you! Send your CV to dan.wotherspoon@intellectgroup.com or get in touch to learn more.

Join us in building smarter, more sustainable cities for generations to come!

Show more
