Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Analyst for a project based in Lisbon (Hybrid work model - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

• Bachelor’s degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Management or a related field;

• Postgraduate degree in Data Science (preferred);

• Minimum of 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst;

• Proficiency in Power BI, MicroStrategy or similar technologies;

• Technical knowledge of SQL;

• Experience/knowledge in Banking and/or Payments (preferred);

• Ability to define KPIs for business/product monitoring;

• Experience in developing and defining dashboards and reporting for business/product monitoring;

• Proficiency in data exploration to identify business value;

• Fluent English (mandatory);

• The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).


If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

What is Holis?

Holis is an entity of the Singulier Group, a consulting firm providing strategic and transformation support for private equity/investment funds and established companies.

Holis is an entrepreneurial initiative to build and drive data analytics expertise at Singulier. With our multiple data sources, we build a holistic view of target companies, their consumers and their market. The goal is to help our clients make informed decisions based on our insights they wouldnʼt otherwise have access to easily.

We work with our strategy consultants or directly with our clients, and manage all our data processing, from data gathering to data visualisation.

To support and accelerate our analyses, we are gradually building a platform that is automating the different data processes used to answer the needs of our clients. Whenever we identify a recurring need, we build the corresponding piece of platform and processes so that everything progressively becomes leaner and more efficient. Ideally, we want to fully automate an comprehensive set of analyses that answers all the questions around a given companyʼs performance.

Being an analyst at Holis

At Holis, the role of the Analytics Team is to help our clients get the most valuable insights from our data.

We work closely with the Tech Team and Singulier consultants to deliver a complete expertise from the initial problem scoping to client delivery, including of course all data steps along the way.

When working on a client case, the Analytics Team responsibilities include: identify and scope relevant analyses to answer a business question gather, clean and enrich data as much as necessary build the analyses, drive conclusions and present our insights

Aside from client cases, the Analytics Team also has a pivotal role in building

Holis. We are ideally fit to identify opportunities for scale and iterating with the Tech team to build our internal assets. Our team carries the voice of our customers and helps guaranteeing that what we build has value for our business. Therefore, this is a highly entrepreneurial, multi skilled team with a lot of possibilities for learning and growth.

📣 Job Description

We are looking for a Data Analyst to work closely with our consultant on client projects to build and deliver the best analyses.

Your missions

After an onboarding and coaching phase, your main objectives will be:


Work on different missions with our consultants on data cleaning, data preparation and data analysis
Implement the Holis “Market & Competitionˮ analyses methodology on new business cases or develop new analysis with the consultants
Optimize each integration productivity to deliver future projects faster, by finding ways to improve the various parts of the data flow
Work with the data engineers to guarantee an always operational data infrastructure


Depending on your skillset, your interests and the needs of Holis, you may also be involved upstream in data engineering projects, or downstream with client facing and consulting responsibilities.

👑 You will arrive at a pivotal moment in the adventure, when Holis is growing and working to stabilize its vision and product.

Our stack

We Like To Try New Things Out But Most Of Our Stack Is Of Course Built Around Python (pandas) And Spark. Here Are The Things We Use

🎨 Notion / Miro

⚙ Python / Spark

🧰 Databricks / Postman

🔧 Gitlab CI / Docker / Clickhouse / Zookeeper / Airflow

🌐 Google Cloud Platform

Requirements

🤖 You want to work on concrete data projects for clients in various types of industries

You have enough experience with Python, Spark, R or any language fit to process data at scale.

Ideally, you graduated from a top engineering Grand Ecole where you specialized in data science or computer science

⚡ You are looking for a startup experience with a dynamic environment and challenges.

You are not afraid to explore and learn new tools, languages, or anything that could be useful to you or the team

Ideally, you have launched your own entrepreneurial project in the past

📈 You have already worked on projects involving data cleaning, preparation, enrichment or visualization

🎖 You are structured and have a sense of ownership and responsibility.

⚙ Hiring process


Introduction meeting with the Expert Partner Data & Insights): 45min
Interview and business case with the interim CPTO : 1h
Technical test
Meet the data team to validate the motivation / culture fit and project yourself onboard this adventure: 1h
HR meeting for the administrative procedures and to answer your questions: 30min
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Júnior – Lisboa
HTML:
Estamos a recrutar Data Analyst Júnior para uma instituição financeira especialista na concessão de Crédito à Habitação, que trabalha há mais de 60 anos com o setor imobiliário e oferece aos seus clientes uma solução global para as necessidades de financiamento na compra de casa.

A FUNÇÃO

O/A Profissional a Admitir Terá Como Principais Responsabilidades

– Gestão, análise e revisão de dados;

– Report;

– Elaboração e atualização de ficheiros;

– Gestão de desenvolvimentos informáticos nas aplicações utilizadas internamente;

– Gestão e cálculo de pagamentos (comissões);

– Lançamento de objetivos comerciais (mensais e anuais).

REQUISITOS

– Formação superior (obrigatório);

– Licenciatura em Gestão, Marketing, Economia, Sistemas de Informação (preferencial);

– 2 anos de experiência em análise de dados (preferencial);

– Conhecimentos de Excel Avançado, Acess, Power Point, Power BI e Teams (obrigatório);

– Conhecimentos de AS400, Power Query, SQL, Visual Basic (preferencial);

– Línguas: português, inglês e espanhol.

O QUE OFERECEMOS

– Contrato de trabalho direto com o cliente;

– Formação profissional e contínua;

– VB + SA em cartão + prémio de equipa + bónus individual;

– Horário de 2ªf a 6ªf das 9h às 18h (após formação em regime híbrido);

– Local de trabalho: Lisboa.

Caso esteja interessado/a nesta oportunidade envie-nos a sua candidatura com o CV atualizado.

Synchro by egor – Lisboa

Success through people

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Como Business Data Analyst (SQL + PowerBI) te integrarás dentro del equipo Digital Data en el área de Ecommerce de Massimo Dutti.




Buscamos personas proactivas, con capacidad para trabajar en equipo y excelentes habilidades técnicas, así como una fuerte orientación a resultados y comprensión estratégica del negocio.




Tus responsabilidades:

Junto con el departamento, definición y cálculo de KPIs avanzados que permitan evaluar el buen performance de las diferentes áreas de negocio.
Extracción, procesamiento y organización de datos. (SQL, Phyton, Snowflake, Big Query).
Conceptualización, diseño y construcción de cuadros de mando en Power BI, destinados a las demás áreas de negocio que consuman la información.
Participar en la elaboración de informes estratégicos.
Interpretación y lectura de los informes siendo capaz de construir insights relevantes a partir de la información contenida en los datos y transmitirla de forma eficiente a las diferentes áreas del negocio.
Trabajar con el resto del equipo de datos (Business Analysts, Data Engineers y Data Scientists) para implementar las soluciones propuestas.




Formación

Formación superior en Ingeniería, ADE, Matemáticas, Estadística o similar.
Valorable Máster en Data Analytics o Data Science.




Experiencia Laboral

Experiencia de al menos 5 años como Data Analyst en entornos digitales, preferiblemente Ecommerce.
Amplia experiencia con bases de datos, SQL y Python.
Habilidad para entender y crear soluciones técnicas utilizando diferentes tecnologías.
Habilidades solidas en visualización de datos en Power BI.
Valorable experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos predictivos y machine learning.




Skills Tecnológicas

Nivel expert en SQL y Phyton.
Nivel avanzado de PowerBi y Excel.
Muy valorable experiencia en Google Analytics 4 (GA4), Big Query, Snowflake y familiarización con productos de la suite de Google.




Skills comunicativas y personales

Habilidades comunicativas tanto en Español como en Inglés.
Fuerte visión de negocio y de cómo el dato puede ser el motor del cambio en las decisiones estratégicas de la compañía.
Habilidad para trabajar de forma autónoma como integrante de un equipo.
Mentalidad orientada a resultados y a resolución de problemas complejos.
Atención al detalle, garantizando precisión e integridad en todos los análisis.
Capacidad de traducir del lenguaje de negocio al técnico y viceversa.
Interés por el mundo de la moda.




Qué te ofrecemos

Dispondrás de un servicio de comedor subvencionado.
Disfrutarás de un gimnasio en nuestras instalaciones, además de clases dirigidas.
Servicio de autobús-empresa subvencionado con salida desde diferentes puntos de Barcelona, Mataró, Vallés.
InLife, un club para acercarte productos y servicios a nuestras oficinas (farmacia, mensajería etc.).
Siendo parte del grupo Inditex podrás comprar en cualquiera de nuestras marcas, con un 25% de descuento.




Massimo Dutti es una empresa comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades.

Show more
HTML:
Como Business Data Analyst (SQL + PowerBI) te integrarás dentro del equipo Digital Data en el área de Ecommerce de Massimo Dutti.


Buscamos personas proactivas, con capacidad para trabajar en equipo y excelentes habilidades técnicas, así como una fuerte orientación a resultados y comprensión estratégica del negocio.


Tus responsabilidades:

  • Junto con el departamento, definición y cálculo de KPIs avanzados que permitan evaluar el buen performance de las diferentes áreas de negocio.
  • Extracción, procesamiento y organización de datos. (SQL, Phyton, Snowflake, Big Query).
  • Conceptualización, diseño y construcción de cuadros de mando en Power BI, destinados a las demás áreas de negocio que consuman la información.
  • Participar en la elaboración de informes estratégicos.
  • Interpretación y lectura de los informes siendo capaz de construir insights relevantes a partir de la información contenida en los datos y transmitirla de forma eficiente a las diferentes áreas del negocio.
  • Trabajar con el resto del equipo de datos (Business Analysts, Data Engineers y Data Scientists) para implementar las soluciones propuestas.


Formación

  • Formación superior en Ingeniería, ADE, Matemáticas, Estadística o similar.
  • Valorable Máster en Data Analytics o Data Science.


Experiencia Laboral

  • Experiencia de al menos 5 años como Data Analyst en entornos digitales, preferiblemente Ecommerce.
  • Amplia experiencia con bases de datos, SQL y Python.
  • Habilidad para entender y crear soluciones técnicas utilizando diferentes tecnologías.
  • Habilidades solidas en visualización de datos en Power BI.
  • Valorable experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos predictivos y machine learning.


Skills Tecnológicas

  • Nivel expert en SQL y Phyton.
  • Nivel avanzado de PowerBi y Excel.
  • Muy valorable experiencia en Google Analytics 4 (GA4), Big Query, Snowflake y familiarización con productos de la suite de Google.


Skills comunicativas y personales

  • Habilidades comunicativas tanto en Español como en Inglés.
  • Fuerte visión de negocio y de cómo el dato puede ser el motor del cambio en las decisiones estratégicas de la compañía.
  • Habilidad para trabajar de forma autónoma como integrante de un equipo.
  • Mentalidad orientada a resultados y a resolución de problemas complejos.
  • Atención al detalle, garantizando precisión e integridad en todos los análisis.
  • Capacidad de traducir del lenguaje de negocio al técnico y viceversa.
  • Interés por el mundo de la moda.


Qué te ofrecemos

  • Dispondrás de un servicio de comedor subvencionado.
  • Disfrutarás de un gimnasio en nuestras instalaciones, además de clases dirigidas.
  • Servicio de autobús-empresa subvencionado con salida desde diferentes puntos de Barcelona, Mataró, Vallés.
  • InLife, un club para acercarte productos y servicios a nuestras oficinas (farmacia, mensajería etc.).
  • Siendo parte del grupo Inditex podrás comprar en cualquiera de nuestras marcas, con un 25% de descuento.


Massimo Dutti es una empresa comprometida con la igualdad de oportunidades.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At Fenergo, our aim is to future-proof Client Lifecyle Management through our award-winning SaaS based solutions that empower financial institutions. With the expertise of our 700 employees across 11 offices worldwide we enable our clients to improve operational efficiencies and return on investment, manage compliance with KYC, AML and reduce risk with continuous monitoring of clients and transactions throughout the client lifecycle.

Fenergo dynamically manages any client type, any product type and every client journey for all segments, channels and devices.

As a company we value collaboration with cross functional teams, driving employee engagement and are champions of diversity and inclusion. As we continue to grow and evolve, we look for team members who will make a meaningful impact, contribute to a positive work environment and shape the future of our organisation.

Join us as we build a workplace where talent thrives and together, we achieve new heights of success!

Requirements

What Will You Do?

You will play a key role in designing, building and maintaining key dataset and models across the organisation which are driven from our cloud-based data lake infrastructure on AWS. You will work closely with a ringfenced team of system engineers, data analysts and a delivery manager to implement best practices for data management and contribute to the overall success of our data platform. This role is ideal for an enthusiastic individual with a strong analytical background who is passionate about working on innovative data projects.

Responsibilities:


Collect, process and analyse data to derive insights and inform business decisions
Develop and maintain datasets and data models
Create visualizations and reports to present findings to stakeholders
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data
Collaborate with teams to define data requirements and goals
Ensure data quality and integrity
Stay current on industry best practices and data analysis techniques
Utilize statistical and analytical tools to interpret data
Monitor and maintain data quality through regular audits and assessments
Collaborate with data governance teams to establish data quality policies
Create and maintain data quality documentation
Train and educate employees on data quality best practices
Perform data profiling and analysis to identify potential data quality problems
Utilize data quality tools and technologies to improve data accuracy and consistency



Expectations


3+ years in a Data Analytics role
You have good experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI
You have strong critical thinking skills and ability to analyse complex datasets
You are proficient in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python or R, middleware solutions such as Workato and have some experience with Snowflake, DBT or Redshift
You are a storyteller, who can communicate your insights to your team and cross functionally
You are great at prioritising, you know when to say yes and equally importantly, you know when to say no and you do that the right way
You are curious, asking great questions, looking to always improve how we work and how you can grow professionally and personally



Our Promise To You

We are striving to become global leaders across all of the categories we operate in and as part of that we are a high-performing highly collaborative team that works cross functionally to accommodate our clients needs.

What we value is at the CORE of how we succeed:


Collaboration: Working together to achieve our best
Outcomes: Drive Success in every engagement
Respect: A collective feeling of inclusion and belonging
Excellence: Continuously raising the bar



Benefits


Healthcare cover through the VHI
Company pension contribution
Life assurance/ Income protection
23 days annual leave
3 company days
Annual bonus opportunity
Work From Home set-up allowance
Opportunity to work with clients and colleagues on a global scale for a world leader in Client Lifecycle Management
Other competitive company benefits, such as flexible working hours, work from home policy, bike to work scheme, sports and social committee, weekly fitness and sports classes and much more
Buddy system for all new starters
Collaborative working environment
Extensive training programs, classroom and online, through ‘Fenergo University'
Opportunity to work on a cutting-edge Fintech Product, using the latest of tools and technologies
Defined training and role tracking to allow you see and assess your own career development and progress.
Active sports and social club
State of the art offices in the heart of Dublin's Docklands with great facilities, canteen and games area



Diversity, Equality, and Inclusivity

Fenergo is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, where all employees are valued, respected, and can reach their full potential. We do not discriminate based on race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Our hiring decisions are based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We believe that a diverse workforce enriches our company culture, fosters innovation, and contributes to our overall success. We strive to provide a fair and supportive environment for all employees, promoting equal opportunities for career development and advancement. We encourage all qualified individuals to apply for employment opportunities and join our team in contributing to a collaborative and inclusive work environment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Gibbs Hybrid are working with a top Irish healthcare organisation and are supporting them in finding an experienced Data Analyst in the Dublin area.




Location: Dublin 1: 2-3 days per week onsite is expected.

Rates of Pay: Ltd/umbrella: €557.04/day - PAYE: €442.48/day

Duration: Awaiting client response




Responsibilities:

Analyse and understand data in line with the business case.
Requirements gathering and data mapping.
Manage scope and change requests effectively.
Collaborate with the engineering team to support development.




Required Skills:

Proficient and experienced in SQL and Python.
Data analysis and data mapping.
Experience with testing, test processes, and requirements.
Ability to interpret and visualise data using the Power BI platform.
Experience investigating issues in data and code.
Strong ability to collaborate as part of a team.




Preferred Skills:

Cloud experience, preferably with Azure.
Experience working as part of an agile delivery model, including:
Stakeholder management, design thinking, clear communication, and business process modelling.
Conducting requirements workshops.
Documenting business cases and managing projects from inception through design to delivery.




If you are a skilled Data Analyst looking for your next challenge in the Dublin area, we would love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in.




To start a career that is out of the ordinary, please apply...




Job Details




HamiltonAI is a Media & Marketing AI Platform helping marketers optimise future media investments and predict the business outcome. The platform applies artificial intelligence and machine learning to media planning across all offline and online media channels.




Come and join our Center of Excellence team as a Data Analyst in Copenhagen.




As a Data Analyst you will be a part of Center of Excellence team in CPH and will participate in ensuring our customers data are being processed correctly into our proprietary platform and aligning with our internal Modelling team on requirements and needs. Thus, a key responsibility will be to make sure that the quality of the data lives up to our internal expectations and general sanity levels.




In return, we offer you a vibrant environment where you have the opportunity to learn about the most cutting edge technologies, experiment and create while working with cool, autonomous teams.




The Center of Excellence team is the central nerve of the company, as it ensures our customers get access to their models, in a timely fashion. The team is one of the main users of our proprietary software, that provides customers with in-depth knowledge of their media and marketing performance, and allows them to predict and optimise their future campaigns.

We imagine that you are an ambitious, data savvy person who takes pride in getting the details right, but at the same time is concerned with the overall end outcome. You may be newly graduated or only have a few years of experience, but you have drive, and talent, take responsibility and are eager to learn and grow fast.




If that sounds like you, we would love to hear from you!




About The Role




As a Data Analyst, here is what you’ll spend most of your time on:

Taking part in customer data onboarding and securing that the data is following our standard specifications
Ensuring high data quality, both syntactically and semantically
Contribute with developing automated dashboards/reports with relevant metrics and statistical summaries
Writing scripts in order to transform data according to specifications.
Being involved in the continuous improvement of our tools and processes which will allow us to improve overall data reliability and quality
Communicate with internal stakeholders in regards to everything data related.
Learning about modelling on our AI platform after the fundamentals have been learned
Having fun!




About You




Here are some competencies/attributes that we look for:

Detailed oriented person with passion for data
Able to analyze large, complex datasets and share key learnings, patterns and outliers
Solid hands-on knowledge of SQL
Good experience with data visualisations
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, able to present and share insights with stakeholders across the teams with different level of data and technical knowledge
Proactive person with can-do attitude, curious about knowledge and skills development
Adaptable and ready to face any challenges as an individual but also supporting others and winning as a team

It’s a plus if you have knowledge of these, but not a requirement:

Experience with Python or Power BI




What We Bring To The Table




International vibrant environment in the center of CPH
Flexibility of working from home a couple of days a week
Access to Premium LinkedIn educational courses
Being part of a global leading brand marketing company placed in 90 different countries




The position requires on-site presence in Copenhagen and we do not have the possibility to relocate candidates




If you see yourself as a part of our team at Kantar and believe that you can contribute something valuable, apply for the position!




Location

Copenhagen, RaadhuspladsenDenmark




Kantar Rewards Statement




At Kantar we have an integrated way of rewarding our people based around a simple, clear and consistent set of principles. Our approach helps to ensure we are market competitive and also to support a pay for performance culture, where your reward and career progression opportunities are linked to what you deliver.




We go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in. Apply for a career that’s out of the ordinary and join us.

We want to create an equality of opportunity in a fair and supportive working environment where people feel included, accepted and are allowed to flourish in a space where their mental health and well being is taken into consideration.

We want to create a more diverse community to expand our talent pool, be locally representative, drive diversity of thinking and better commercial outcomes.




Kantar is the world’s leading data, insights and consulting company. We understand more about how people think, feel, shop, share, vote and view than anyone else. Combining our expertise in human understanding with advanced technologies, Kantar’s 30,000 people help the world’s leading organisations succeed and grow.

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
¡Buscamos un/a Analista de datos! ¿Quieres unirte al equipo?




Nuestra esencia nos ha llevado a la vanguardia de la tecnología y a ofrecer las soluciones que realmente se corresponden a las necesidades de cada cliente. Nuestro talento nos ha hecho poder decir con orgullo que somos una de las 6 empresas TOP de tecnologías en el mundo.




Desde hace muchos años, hemos liderado grandes proyectos con empresas de gran relevancia a nivel nacional, así como a nivel internacional, teniendo presencia en ámbitos como la industria, la sanidad, el sector energético, y un largo etcétera. En este momento, ampliamos equipo y buscamos una persona interesada en participar en proyectos en el sector bancario.




¿Te apetece un nuevo reto? Buscamos analistas de datos con interés en desarrollar su carrera profesional en el campo de soluciones de datos para el sector bancario.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?

Apoyo a áreas usuarias de negocio para la conceptualización de soluciones de datos e identificación de requerimientos informacionales.
Conceptualización de modelos de datos y definición de las taxonomías.
Definición de modelos lógico de datos y soporte a equipos de ingeniería para su posterior implementación.
Analizar procesos para proporcionar información estratégica y recomendaciones.
Soporte a productivizaciones de modelos y procesos.
Soporte en el tratamiento y aprovisionamiento de datos.
Soporte en la explotación y análisis de la información.
Recopilación, tratamiento y gestión de grandes conjuntos de datos.
Preparar informes detallados y presentaciones que comuniquen de manera efectiva las conclusiones de los análisis y las recomendaciones.




¿Qué nos gustaría que aportaras?

3 años de experiencia en el ámbito del análisis de datos.
Formación universitaria: ingeniería informática, ADE, Economía, Matemáticas...
Experiencia en el sector financiero.
Conocimientos técnicos de programación (SAS, SQL, Python o R), bases de datos y sistemas de información.
Valorable conocimientos de herramientas de BI.
Valorable B2 de inglés.




Y... ¿Qué te ofrecemos nosotros?

Horario y teletrabajo flexibles, capacidad de autoorganización.
Seguro médico, Ayuda Flex, Seguro de vida, etc.
Plan de carrera, donde puedes promocionar anualmente y dirigir tu desarrollo profesional hacía donde más cómodo/a te sientas.
Universidad corporativa y acceso a la plataforma Udemy, así como al programa de certificaciones asumidas por la compañía.




En NTT Data creemos que toda persona es única y diferente y por ello apostamos por una cultura inclusiva que reconoce y valora la diversidad. Trabajamos día a día para crear un entorno en el que podamos explorar, vivir y potenciar nuestra propia singularidad.




No esperes más y ¡apúntate!




#WeAreAllUnique #YouMakeUsUnique

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and we are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.


More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to make sure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues, as well as the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!


Data Analyst

What you’ll have to do:


  • Drive the conception, implementation, and development of the BI reporting landscape. This includes understanding stakeholder business needs, drafting specifications and monitoring/reviewing implementation with the BI team;
  • Act as a business partner and advisor for the commercial and financial department. Some recurrent needs can be solved with the help of the BI team, while other custom solutions should be provided by us. This means accessing and processing the data in a way that answers those needs;
  • Present results in a well-structured, efficient, and clear manner;
  • Derivate strategic recommendations based on comprehensive data analysis;
  • Standardize processes and reporting for enhanced efficiency;
  • Prepare ad-hoc reports and draw conclusions related to profitability, deliveries, product availability, active promotions, inventory levels, etc. based on stakeholder requests;
  • Offer support on data gathering, consolidation and verifications within the finance team.


How we’d like you to be:

  • 1-4 years of professional experience in data analysis;
  • Extensive knowledge of Excel and writing SQL queries;
  • Basic to intermediate knowledge of Pandas (Python) is an advantage;
  • Intermediate knowledge of BI tools (Tableau) is an advantage;
  • Strong organizational skills, ability to work independently, with a focus on quality, detail, and accuracy;
  • Quick comprehension and ability to grasp new topics in detail;
  • Enthusiasm for developing, organizing, and analyzing large datasets;
  • Ability to describe complicated issues concisely and understandably;
  • High-quality standards for your own work;
  • Excellent spoken and written English skills.

What we’ve prepared for you:


  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Tazz, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Atlas psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Data Analyst - Python, PowerBI & Tableau
HTML:
Decskill was founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company and their main mission is to delivery value through the knowledge. We enable companies to meet the chalenges of digital world by providing our clients with business models that ensure technological capacity, flexibility and agility. We are more than 500 consultants with offices in Lisbon, Porto and Madrid.


DECSKILL operates in 3 main areas:

• DECSKILL TALENT, through which we provide our clients with an extension to their IT teams;

• DECSKILL BOOST, through which we provide our client with software development models to increase capacity and optimize Time-to-Market, where we create and manage teams that deliver according to their needs, at the desired speed;

• DECSKILL CONNECT, through which we provide our client with consulting services, as well as the implementation and management of information technology infrastructures.


Our practice results in the creation of value for our customers, either by delivering qualified and value-added services, or through highly qualified and motivated professionals, as well as technology solutions that allow us to operate and transform the business of our customers.


We are looking for a Data Analyst - Python, PowerBI & Tableau for a project based in Porto (Hybrid work model - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

  • Follow-up and coordination of scrum backlog features;
  • Document the components and operation of application: Software Architecture, Technical Architecture and monitoring & alarmistic;
  • Have experience in Support L2 and L3;
  • Good knowledge of scripting languages as Python or other data language;
  • Good knowledge of ticking system as Jira or service now;
  • Good knowledge of Power BI, Tableau;
  • Good knowledge of OLAP concepts, such as SSAS;
  • Good knowledge of Data structures and algorithms;
  • Good knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies;
  • Fluent English (mandatory).
  • The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).


If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Analista de datos - Banking
Description:
En NTT DATA Europe & LATAM creemos que toda persona es única y por ello apostamos por una cultura inclusiva que reconoce y valora la diversidad. ¡Queremos que formes parte de un equipo tan diverso como lo son los 50 países en los que estamos presentes!




Somos un referente en consultoría y actualmente estamos ampliando nuestros equipos en Barcelona. Concretamente, estamos en la búsqueda de perfiles analistas de datos altamente competentes, con pasión por el sector bancario y con habilidades avanzadas de programación en Python. La persona desempeñará un papel clave en el análisis de datos financieros, la generación de reportes y la automatización de procesos.




Esta posición ofrece la oportunidad de unir finanzas y tecnología, brindando la posibilidad de influir directamente en las decisiones estratégicas de la empresa a través de la aplicación de análisis avanzados y soluciones automatizadas.




¿Qué necesitamos de ti?

Experiencia sólida en análisis financiero y comprensión de datos.
Perfil referente en tareas de análisis y desarrollo en SQL y Python con experiencia de más de un año.
Habilidades analíticas y de resolución de problemas.




¿Cuáles son los requisitos deseables?

Conocimiento funcional en Banca.
Spark / Scala, DataFrames y gestión de SparkSession.
Conocimiento en AWS.
Conocimientos en herramientas de BI (MicroStrategy, PowerBI, Tableau, Looker)
Experiencia en gestión y ejecución de proyectos ágiles: Scrum.




¿Cuáles son las competencias?

Análisis Financiero
Desarrollo de Modelos en Python:
Gestión de Datos
Colaboración Interdepartamental:
Elaboración de Informes




Valoramos personas con iniciativa, alto grado de autonomía, capacidad de adaptación y flexibilidad :)




¿Qué te ofrecemos?

💼 Estabilidad laboral: Contrato indefinido y participación en proyectos punteros de consultoría tecnológica con tecnologías de nueva generación.




📈 Retribución competitiva: Reuniones de objetivos con tu responsable y revisiones de categoría y salario. Contamos con un modelo de carrera profesional adaptado a ti.




🔝 Plan de carrera flexible e individualizado: Queremos que crezcas y llegues hasta donde te propongas; además de nuestro programa de mentoring, tendrás referentes de los que podrás aprender cada día.




📝 Formación ajustada a tus necesidades: Acceso gratuito a nuestra Universidad Corporativa para realizar formaciones técnicas, certificaciones, cursos de idiomas, formaciones en soft skills y mucho más.




👩🏽‍💻 Facilidad de conciliación: Modalidad de trabajo híbrido (teletrabajo) y flexibilidad horaria gracias a nuestro modelo beflex.




🏥 Beneficios sociales y corporativos: Ayuda flex, seguro médico, seguro de vida y accidentes, tickets restaurant, salario flexible, descuentos en numerosos productos y servicios por ser profesional de NTT DATA y muchos más.




🌏 Programas solidarios: Podrás participar en numerosos programas solidarios, voluntariados y actividades sociales enfocados a mejorar el mundo a través de la tecnología.




¡Te esperamos! Únete al movimiento #TheDigitalLovers.

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Arcaplanet consolida la sua leadership e la sua strategia di crescita con l’apertura di decine di nuovi punti vendita ogni anno su tutto il territorio nazionale, con lo sviluppo del canale on line e di tutte le formule digitali in logica omnichannel integrata e con lo sviluppo dell’offerta di nuovi servizi dedicati ai Pet.

A supporto di tale strategia e con un forte orientamento customer centric, investe nello sviluppo delle professionalità che operano sia nel Retail che nell’Headquarter con l’obiettivo costante di garantire la massima soddisfazione ed un servizio di eccellenza.


In questo contesto di riferimento, cerchiamo un/una:


BUSINESS DATA ANALYST


Stiamo ricercando un/a risorsa il cui compito sarà quello di supportare il team e-commerce nella gestione dei dati al fine di migliorare l’esperienza di acquisto del cliente.

Principali responsabilità

  • Raccoglierai e analizzerai i dati aziendali per identificare tendenze, opportunità e problemi;
  • Utilizzerai strumenti di data visualization come Tableau, Power BI per creare report e dashboard interattivi e informativi;
  • Fornirai analisi approfondite per supportare le decisioni aziendali e le strategie di crescita;
  • Monitorerai le performance dell'e-commerce e fornirai suggerimenti per migliorare l'esperienza del cliente e ottimizzare i processi di vendita;
  • Identificherai le sfide operative e suggerirai soluzioni per migliorare l'efficienza aziendale;
  • Collaborerai con i colleghi per raggiungere obiettivi comuni e misurerai i risultati in base alle metriche prestabilite.



Requisiti richiesti


  • Almeno 2 anni di esperienza come Business Analyst o ruoli simili;
  • Competenza avanzata nell'utilizzo di Tableau,
  • Power BI e Excel per l'analisi e la visualizzazione dei dati;
  • Conoscenza di pacchetti statistici come Excel,SPSS e strumenti ETL;
  • Esperienza su piattaforma Salesforce Cloud Platform e delle sue dinamiche;
  • Conoscenza di SQL, data warehouse, business intelligence e linguaggi di programmazione come R, Python;
  • Conoscenza delle dinamiche di un e-commerce e delle principali metriche di business;
  • Capacità di lavorare in modo autonomo e in team, con orientamento agli obiettivi;
  • Proattività nel proporre nuove idee e soluzioni innovative;
  • Ottima capacità comunicativa e di presentazione per comunicare gli insights ai diversi stakeholder;
  • Buone capacità analitiche e di problem-solving;
  • Spirito di apprendimento costante e desiderio di mantenere un'aggiornata conoscenza delle tendenze del settore.


Cosa Offriamo:


Offriamo un ambiente molto dinamico e flessibile in un’azienda leader, in costante crescita e con un mercato in forte evoluzione;

Benefits e pacchetto retributivo da valutare sulla base dell’esperienza del candidato;

Smart working

# Siamo attenti al pianeta, alle nostre persone e ai nostri amici animali.


Sede di lavoro: Milano.

E' richiesta la disponibilità a trasferte nell'Headquarter di Carasco (Genova).


Il presente annuncio è rivolto ad entrambi i sessi, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di tutte le età e tutte le nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.







At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join us in Porto.




Requirements:

Information systems background.
Knowledge of Application design and Data Visualization modeling.
Knowledge of ETL Processes and some experinece wih Python
Databases / SQL language and Data Modeling.
Data Visualization / Restitution tools experience - Power BI.
Fluency in spoken English.




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to goncalo.delgado@decskill.com with reference “GD / DAP”.




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Accelerate your development and exposure to high performance applications and cloud infrastructure. Join Faptic Technology, a fast-growing scale-up organization with an ambition to be recognized as one of the leading technology companies in Romania.

Our global client base needs builders: engineers and developers who love technology, have deep expertise in software and cloud technologies, and importantly, have a passion for culture and customers.


We obsess about our customers
We build outstanding technical solutions
We create an awesome culture
We accelerate learning and careers


As a Junior Data Analyst, you will join a team who deals with cutting-edge technologies every day and strives to utilize integration services to their limits. You will be taking part in Solution and Architectural designs as well as introducing and proposing new methods and technologies through well tested Proof-of-Concepts. You will Design, develop and deploy pipelines, create snaps and extract data in various downstream applications. You will develop interfaces, troubleshoot and fix integration issues.

Your activities will include:


Work extensively with SQL databases to analyze, manage, and retrieve data
Receive mentorship and support for continuous technical learning and development
Analyze functional specifications/user stories and translate them into detailed technical requirements
Research and evaluate new technologies and solutions to enhance analytical capabilities
Develop and implement Proof of Concepts, guiding solutions through their complete life cycle
Design, develop, and deploy data pipelines for efficient data processing and management
Create custom snaps and extract data for use in various downstream applications
Develop and maintain integration interfaces, including troubleshooting and resolving any integration issues
Contribute to policy and procedure development (e.g., cloud adoption) and create documentation and user guides



Requirements


University degree in Computer Science, Engineering or a similar discipline
At least 2 years of experience in working with databases / SQL
Knowledge of ETL design principles is a plus
Knowledge or previous experience in solution design
Strong organizational, communicational and documentation skills
Self-motivated, detail-oriented, strong team player
English is a must



Benefits


Private medical insurance 
Training on market trends and client needs 
Continuous personal improvement - 8h/month during work hours 
Lunch on Friday (twice per month, we pay)
21 days annual leave, with one day per year extra up to 25 days 
3 days sick leave without medical proof off
1 day for your Birthday off 
0.5 days Christmas Shopping off 
Competitive salary package
Quarterly fun budget for team events 
Show more

Title: Analista dati
Place: Metropolitan City of Bologna, Emilia-Romagna, Italy
Description:
Il nostro cliente è un'azienda del settore dell'Energy Management, operante nel campo della consulenza e dei servizi per le imprese. Per la sede di BOLOGNA ricerchiamo una figura di:




DATA ANALYST




La risorsa, inserita all'interno del team Operations, si occuperà di:




Supportare il team di relazione e sviluppo nell'interfacciarsi con i clienti per la raccolta dati e la produzione di reportistica;
Utilizzare operativamente i sistemi informatici aziendali, in particolare le funzioni di CRM, fatturazione e ticketing: analisi dei dati di fatturazione delle utenze power e gas, predisposizione di reportistiche periodiche, analisi dei consumi energetici ed elaborazione di simulazioni di spesa, predisposizione di report di fatturazione delle ricariche delle colonnine elettriche;
·Collaborare con altre aree aziendali per la corretta interpretazione ed applicazione della normativa di settore, in particolare per le attività di aggiornamento dei corrispettivi di fatturazione;
·Supportare il team di Back-office & Operations nella gestione dei principali processi di back-office del settore energia & gas (es. richieste di switch e connessione e attività di customer service).




Requisiti




Desideriamo entrare in contatto con candidatə in possesso dei seguenti requisiti:




Laurea magistrale in Economia, Statistica, Matematica, Ingegneria Gestionale o discipline affini;
Ottima conoscenza della Suite Microsoft 365, in particolare Excel;
Capacità di elaborare, manipolare e interpretare grandi quantità di dati;




Altre informazioni

Si offre inserimento diretto in azienda mediante contratto a tempo indeterminato e retribuzione commisurata all'esperienza, oltre ad un interessante sistema di welfare aziendale.

Orario: full time

Modalità: ibrida

Sede di lavoro: Bologna




L'offerta è rivolta a candidatə nel rispetto del Dlgs 198/2006 e dei Dlgs 215/2003 e 216/2003.

Le persone interessate sono invitate a leggere l'informativa privacy ex artt. 13 e 14 del Reg. UE 2016/679.

Aut. Min. Prot. N. 1207 – SG del 16/12/2004

Candidati per questo annuncio

Title: Data Analyst - Smart Cities
Description:
Data Analyst – AI/LLM (Entry-Mid Level)

Location: Berlin, Germany | Salary: €50,000 – €65,000 per year + Benefits




Our client, a pioneer in smart cities and urban innovation, is seeking a motivated Data Analyst to join their Berlin team. This is a unique opportunity to work with cutting-edge AI and large language models (LLMs) to reshape how cities operate and evolve. From optimizing urban mobility to enhancing energy efficiency, you’ll be part of a team creating the cities of the future.




About the Role

You’ll play a vital role in analyzing and refining data from AI-powered solutions tailored to smart city applications. These solutions integrate real-time data on transportation, energy consumption, public services, and environmental metrics to provide actionable insights for urban planners, policymakers, and city operators.




Responsibilities

Analyze and interpret large datasets related to urban systems, including transportation networks, energy grids, and environmental monitoring.
Collaborate with AI and engineering teams to improve the accuracy and functionality of LLMs applied to smart city challenges.
Develop predictive models and dashboards to support decision-making for urban development and sustainability goals.
Conduct experiments and A/B testing to enhance user engagement and optimize system performance.
Present insights to stakeholders, including city governments and private partners, to support strategic initiatives.




What You’ll Need

Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Urban Planning, Computer Science, or related fields.
Technical Expertise: Proficiency in Python, SQL, or R; familiarity with geospatial tools (e.g., GIS) and AI/ML frameworks is highly desirable.
Industry Knowledge: A keen interest in smart cities, urban planning, or sustainability-focused industries.
Analytical Skills: Ability to draw meaningful insights from complex datasets and present findings tailored to urban applications.
Experience Level: 1–3 years in data analysis, ideally within urban systems or technology projects.
Language Skills: Fluency in English is essential; German is a strong advantage.




Salary & Benefits

Competitive salary: €50,000 – €65,000 per year, depending on experience.
Benefits include comprehensive health insurance, flexible working hours, and professional development opportunities.
Hybrid work environment based in Berlin, with remote work options.
The chance to work on impactful projects that are shaping the future of urban living.




Why Join?

This is your opportunity to merge your data expertise with a passion for innovation in urban environments. You’ll be joining a forward-thinking team that’s leveraging AI to tackle some of the most pressing challenges facing modern cities, from traffic congestion to carbon emissions.




How to Apply

If this exciting role sounds like a match for your skills and aspirations, we’d love to hear from you! Send your CV to dan.wotherspoon@intellectgroup.com or get in touch to learn more.

Join us in building smarter, more sustainable cities for generations to come!

Show more
HTML:
Data Analyst – AI/LLM (Entry-Mid Level)

Location: Berlin, Germany | Salary: €50,000 – €65,000 per year + Benefits


Our client, a pioneer in smart cities and urban innovation, is seeking a motivated Data Analyst to join their Berlin team. This is a unique opportunity to work with cutting-edge AI and large language models (LLMs) to reshape how cities operate and evolve. From optimizing urban mobility to enhancing energy efficiency, you’ll be part of a team creating the cities of the future.


About the Role

You’ll play a vital role in analyzing and refining data from AI-powered solutions tailored to smart city applications. These solutions integrate real-time data on transportation, energy consumption, public services, and environmental metrics to provide actionable insights for urban planners, policymakers, and city operators.


Responsibilities

  • Analyze and interpret large datasets related to urban systems, including transportation networks, energy grids, and environmental monitoring.
  • Collaborate with AI and engineering teams to improve the accuracy and functionality of LLMs applied to smart city challenges.
  • Develop predictive models and dashboards to support decision-making for urban development and sustainability goals.
  • Conduct experiments and A/B testing to enhance user engagement and optimize system performance.
  • Present insights to stakeholders, including city governments and private partners, to support strategic initiatives.


What You’ll Need

  • Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Urban Planning, Computer Science, or related fields.
  • Technical Expertise: Proficiency in Python, SQL, or R; familiarity with geospatial tools (e.g., GIS) and AI/ML frameworks is highly desirable.
  • Industry Knowledge: A keen interest in smart cities, urban planning, or sustainability-focused industries.
  • Analytical Skills: Ability to draw meaningful insights from complex datasets and present findings tailored to urban applications.
  • Experience Level: 1–3 years in data analysis, ideally within urban systems or technology projects.
  • Language Skills: Fluency in English is essential; German is a strong advantage.


Salary & Benefits

  • Competitive salary: €50,000 – €65,000 per year, depending on experience.
  • Benefits include comprehensive health insurance, flexible working hours, and professional development opportunities.
  • Hybrid work environment based in Berlin, with remote work options.
  • The chance to work on impactful projects that are shaping the future of urban living.


Why Join?

This is your opportunity to merge your data expertise with a passion for innovation in urban environments. You’ll be joining a forward-thinking team that’s leveraging AI to tackle some of the most pressing challenges facing modern cities, from traffic congestion to carbon emissions.


How to Apply

If this exciting role sounds like a match for your skills and aspirations, we’d love to hear from you! Send your CV to dan.wotherspoon@intellectgroup.com or get in touch to learn more.

Join us in building smarter, more sustainable cities for generations to come!

Title: Data Analyst H/F
HTML:
Depuis plus de 30 ans, le groupe Emeis s’est donné comme mission la santé et l’accompagnement de personnes en état de grande fragilité.


Nous sommes près de 78 000 médecins, infirmiers, aides-soignants, auxiliaires de vie, rééducateurs, psychologues, cuisiniers, gouvernants, et métiers d’appui… engagés chaque jour auprès des personnes fragiles :


- Au sein de nos cliniques de soins médicaux et de réadaptation

- Au sein de nos cliniques de santé mentale

- Au sein de nos maisons de retraite (EHPAD)

- Avec des services d’aide à domicile.


Nous proposons à chacune des personnes dont nous prenons soin un parcours sur-mesure, avec une réponse à chaque étape (de la prévention au traitement et jusqu’à la réadaptation).


Nous construisons avec et pour chacune d’elles un projet de soins personnalisé qui intègre tous ses besoins (médical, psychique, humain et social) car chaque résident, patient et bénéficiaire est unique.


Chez emeis, nous sommes forces de vie.


La/Le « Data Analyst » joue un rôle clé dans la transformation par la data de l’experience client, collaborateur et image de marque du groupe Emeis en France.


Rattaché(e) au Directeur Data et Digital, elle/il a pour mission d’exploiter et d’analyser les données issues de divers domaines, notamment le marketing, le commercial, les opérations et le médical. L’objectif est de produire des insights transversaux et actionnables qui soutiennent la prise de décision stratégique et opérationnelle dans l’ensemble des secteurs d’activité du groupe.


Ce poste requiert une étroite collaboration avec les équipes de DSI, Marketing, Commercial, Opérations, et Médicales.


Les missions principales :


Mission 1 : Analyse des données transversales (Marketing, Commercial, Opérationnel, Médical)


  • Analyse les données provenant de multiples domaines (marketing, commercial, opérationnel et médical) pour dégager des tendances et des comportements clés propres à chaque secteur ;
  • Identifie des opportunités d’optimisation et fournit des recommandations stratégiques adaptées aux différents domaines d’activité ;
  • Produit des rapports et des tableaux de bord permettant aux équipes métiers de suivre les indicateurs de performance clés dans leurs domaines respectifs.


Mission 2 : Développement et maintenance des outils de reporting automatisés


  • Pour les usages récurrents, le data analyst participe avec le responsable data et IA et les équipes data groupe à la construction de reporting automatisés couvrant l’ensemble des domaines de données, y compris les indicateurs médicaux et opérationnels ;
  • Travaille en collaboration avec les équipes le datasteward pour garantir la fiabilité des outils de visualisation et des flux de données ;
  • Documente les processus analytiques pour assurer la continuité et la cohérence des solutions déployées


Mission 3 : Support analytique auprès des équipes métiers


  • Apporte une expertise analytique approfondie pour répondre aux besoins spécifiques des équipes marketing, commerciales, opérationnelles, et médicales ;
  • Réalise des analyses ad hoc en fonction des besoins spécifiques de chaque département et fournit des recommandations basées sur des données pour orienter les décisions ;
  • Participe aux comités transverses pour partager les insights data et proposer des actions basées sur les analyses réalisées.


Mission 4 : Appui à la qualité et à la gouvernance des données


  • Participe activement à la validation et à la gouvernance de la qualité des données en coordination avec les équipes de la DSI ;


Mission 5 : Innovation


  • Produit une veille concurrentielle et technologique sur les outils data et IA.


Profil recherché


  • Formation : Bac+5 en statistique, économie, data science, ingénierie ou discipline équivalente ;
  • Expérience : 4 à 6 ans en analyse de données, idéalement dans un environnement multidisciplinaire incluant le marketing, l’opérationnel, et si possible des domaines spécialisés comme la santé ;
  • Compétences techniques : Maîtrise d’Excel, SQL, et des outils de Business Intelligence (la connaissance de Qlik Sense est un plus) ; des compétences en Python et en modélisation de données seraient appréciées ;
  • Qualités professionnelles : Excellentes capacités analytiques, sens de l’organisation, curiosité, rigueur et autonomie ;
  • Communication : Aptitude à présenter des résultats complexes de manière claire et adaptée aux besoins spécifiques de chaque domaine métier
  • Polyvalence et adaptabilité : Capacité à jongler avec des enjeux divers et à intégrer rapidement les spécificités des différents secteurs d’activité du groupe.


Ce que nous proposons :


  • Une expérience professionnelle et humaine : vous intégrerez avant tout une équipe engagée auprès de laquelle vous prendrez plaisir à travailler chaque jour ;
  • Des opportunités pour vous et votre carrière : vous pourrez développer vos compétences, diversifier vos connaissances et enrichir votre parcours à travers des formations personnalisées et des partages d’expériences ;
  • Une ouverture à tous les professionnels : nous sommes attentifs à proposer un environnement de travail favorables à tous, qui donne les moyens de bien exercer son métier et qui met en place les aménagements et l’accompagnement à la prise de poste nécessaires ;
  • Les avantages d’un grand groupe : primes cooptation, places en crèches, accord d’intéressement, 13eme mois, titres restaurants ou rie, télétravail (2 jours/semaine).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 2016, LogRocket's goal is to make every experience on the web as perfect as possible. We're solving a huge challenge for product managers and developers - understanding the user experience. LogRocket is the first system that gives these teams complete visibility into their customer's experience using their web apps - through pixel-perfect replays of user sessions and clear insight into logs, errors, and network activity. We've already attracted an elite roster of almost 3,000 customers including ClassPass, Capital One, Cisco, and Rippling, just to name a few. Our focus is on building software with care and craftsmanship and our engineering blog posts offer a taste of that.

Backed by top investors such as Matrix Partners, Battery Ventures, and Delta-V Capital, we've raised $55M in funding and we're eager to bring talented people onboard to support our growth. We're on a mission to improve society's experience with software and that's where you come in.

You Will...


Work with Sales, Marketing and R&D leadership to plan and run in-depth analytical research to drive key business decisions across the company
Recommend areas of improvement across a variety of business initiatives as we grow >100% year over year through self-guided analysis
Build curated dashboards and reports to communicate meaningful metrics
Collaborate with data-driven internal stakeholders to identify opportunities for better data access and usage
Structure disparate data sources into clean data models that power self-service analytics


About You


2+ years experience in similar analytics roles, preferably in the tech/SaaS industry
Highly proficient in SQL- you can write complex joins and window functions in your sleep
Experience with one or two general-purpose programming languages (Python, Java, Javascript, etc.) a huge plus
Experience taking on broadly scoped analytics projects and delivering impactful results
Comfortable building relationships with a variety of different business stakeholders at multiple levels of technical proficiency
Curiosity and enthusiasm for digging into messy data and extracting impactful insights from it
Experience with modern data visualization tools like Looker or Tableau (we use Metabase)
Experience with dbt, git, and command line a huge plus


Benefits & Perks


Extensive health, dental, and vision benefits
Open vacation policy - we all work hard and take time for ourselves when we need it, no strings attached
Three months of fully-paid parental leave to any employee welcoming a child into their home
401k and commuter benefits
Generous stock options - we all get to own a piece of what we’re building
Regular team outings and activities
Flexible working hours and location
Monthly employee gifts
For those in office, catered lunches throughout the week and a fully stocked kitchen with all your favorite snacks (healthy & non-healthy)


Even if you don’t meet all of the listed requirements, we still encourage you to apply. We believe learning is a vital component of success in any role here at LogRocket, and we’re happy to chat with folks from non-traditional backgrounds for our open roles.

LogRocket is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities

Kforce has a client that is looking for a Data Analyst in Boston, MA. We are seeking a highly motivated, proactive professional with excellent data and interpersonal skills who are eager to learn about asset management! Responsibilities:


Data Analyst will develop and implement a repeatable process aimed at streamlining the data sourcing, aggregation, quality & distribution
Research, recommend and implement automation, digitization, and new scalable solutions for distributing data
Partner with members of business and technology teams to develop Project and Execution Plans, establish agreed-upon milestones and raise issues, as necessary; Ensure timely production and meet calendar deadlines
As a Data Analyst, you will participate in other data-related efforts to support ad-hoc reporting and analysis
Operationally monitor, govern, and triage data issues arising from nightly batch or real time data sourcing, working with internal and external partners and vendors


Requirements


Bachelor's degree required
1-3 years or more in a data intensive, hands on environment, preferably within investment management or technology industries
Introductory experience with system development projects, business analysis, and data analysis
Basic knowledge of asset allocation investment products, Performance, Attribution, Fixed Income and Risk related experience
Prior Experience with Reporting and Visualization Tools like Tableau, Spotfire, Alteryx or other BI, Data Prep, Blending, etc.
Basic understanding of AI/ML concepts, R, Python or Scala is preferred
Exposure to Private Equity, Private Debt and Private Real Assets data, vendors and investment processes; Any experience with vendors like Preqin, Blue Vault, Pitchbook, Burgiss, Cliffwater, etc. is a big plus
Understanding of MS Excel (macros, VLOOKUP's, VBA) and PowerPoint
Good data querying skills using SQL, TOAD, Tableau, Excel, or any other applications
Basic project management skills and ability to prioritize multiple work streams, track progress and effectively communicate and handle expectations
Basic analytical skills and business judgment
Intellectual curiosity and commitment to continuous improvement
Interest in CFA/CAIA/Financial certification is good to have but not required


The pay range is the lowest to highest compensation we reasonably in good faith believe we would pay at posting for this role. We may ultimately pay more or less than this range. Employee pay is based on factors like relevant education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, seniority, location, performance, union contract and business needs. This range may be modified in the future.

We offer comprehensive benefits including medical/dental/vision insurance, HSA, FSA, 401(k), and life, disability & ADD insurance to eligible employees. Salaried personnel receive paid time off. Hourly employees are not eligible for paid time off unless required by law. Hourly employees on a Service Contract Act project are eligible for paid sick leave.

Note: Pay is not considered compensation until it is earned, vested and determinable. The amount and availability of any compensation remains in Kforce's sole discretion unless and until paid and may be modified in its discretion consistent with the law.

This job is not eligible for bonuses, incentives or commissions.

Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

By clicking “Apply Today” you agree to receive calls, AI-generated calls, text messages or emails from Kforce and its affiliates, and service providers. Note that if you choose to communicate with Kforce via text messaging the frequency may vary, and message and data rates may apply. Carriers are not liable for delayed or undelivered messages. You will always have the right to cease communicating via text by using key words such as STOP.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Posting Description

DATA ANALYST, MIT Energy Initiative , to serve as an advisor to the Institute Innovation Fellow (IIF), helping to conduct analysis across an array of projects. Reporting to the Public Sector Data Manager, will primarily focus on building key aspects of the Global Clean Energy Investment Monitor (GCIM) project, for which the IIF serves as principal investigator. The GCIM is a joint project of MIT’s Center for Energy and Environmental Research and the Rhodium Group, a research firm and builds off of and expands from the domestic Clean Investment Monitor launched in late 2023. Responsible for research and analysis within the IIF’s research agenda, including economic policy, climate policy, energy policy, sustainability, and industrial/manufacturing policy. Build and maintain databases for the Global Clean Investment Monitor (GCIM) by compiling and analyzing data on global clean energy subsidies. Collaborate with MIT CEEPR and the Rhodium Group to update and produce original research for the Clean Investment Monitor (CIM). Design and build data architecture, pipelines, and products to solve climate policy and other policy data problems. Support the drafting and publishing of research papers, working papers, op-eds, and other written products by analyzing GCIM data. Present findings, approaches, and processes to the team clearly. Participate in public-facing research projects by preparing talking points and materials with the MIT CEEPR team.

Job Requirements

REQUIRED: Bachelor’s degree required and a minimum of two years of relevant experience required. Preferred: Research experience in government, public policy or related field; extensive data analysis skills and experience, including data management and analysis in excel; strong entrepreneurial capabilities, including ability to implement a long-term and technical plan of action with minimal supervision; experience working on climate change, sustainability, energy policy and/or trade policy as well as economic issues; strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills; experience advising and working with senior officers of an organization; strong organizational capabilities; ability to work collaboratively. Job #24717-7

12/20/2024

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
This Boston-based home services firm is looking to hire a Data Analyst to join their Boston team. Located near Boston North Station, the role will be hybrid, 2-3 days in the office, so someone local to Boston. You will need at least 1 year of professional experience building dashboards and reports in Power BI. This person should have solid SQL skills and any experience working with Snowflake, doing data transformation and cleansing work would be a big plus. The company is growing and while you are the first data hire, the team will grow in the future!

Responsibilities

Understand the day-to-day issues that our business faces, which can be better understood with data
Compile and analyze data related to business issues
Develop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashion
Ability to work with external consultants and learn quickly




Qualifications




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Analytics, Applied Mathematics, or equivalent experience
1-2 years of Data Analysis experience working with Power BI
Solid SQL experience in data transformation, data ingestion, and cleansing
Snowflake, Fivetran, or Databricks will be a big plus
Comfortable meeting with company executives and working as the sole internal data resource.




This company is currently unable to provide sponsorship, visa transfer, or C2C.
